revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-09 17:07:07.000000000', 'message': '[Train Only] Make the docker restart in hybrid state indempotent.

Currently, we need to perform some docker container operation/restart in order
to take configuration changes into account. However, these tasks are not
indempotent enough. The docker service restart will always run even though the
configuration file was already changed (in case you re-run the upgrade command).

This change will only restart the container/service when the task that modifies
the files is considered as changed.

Change-Id: Id8cc95fc4e714d934a503de32667dfde0bf9d9b5
Closes-Bug: TO ADD
Resolves: TO ADD
'}, {'created': '2020-12-10 11:33:16.000000000', 'message': '[Train Only] Make the docker restart in hybrid state idempotent.

Currently, we need to perform some docker container operation/restart in order
to take configuration changes into account. However, these tasks are not
idempotent enough, The docker service restart will always run even though the
configuration file was already changed (in case you re-run the upgrade command).

This change will only restart the container/service when the task that modifies
the files is considered as changed. In order to achieve this we are replacing all
the crudini shell taks by ini_file module calls.

Change-Id: Id8cc95fc4e714d934a503de32667dfde0bf9d9b5

commit_message:
[Train Only] Make the docker restart in hybrid state idempotent.

Currently, we need to perform some docker container
operation/restart in order to take configuration changes
into account. However, these tasks are not idempotent enough.
The docker service restart will always run even though the
configuration file was already changed (in case you re-run the
upgrade command).

This change will only restart the container/service when the
task that modifies the files is considered as changed. In
order to achieve this we are replacing all the crudini shell
tasks by ini_file module calls.

Change-Id: Id8cc95fc4e714d934a503de32667dfde0bf9d9b5
Closes-Bug: #1907655
Resolves: rhbz#1906367

This test fails if /etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring
exists.  Mock out isfile() to get the behavior the unit
test expects.

Change-Id: Ie9fd2a0e14b426c68f7c7a22db590a2d94fa0084

commit_message:
Tests: Fix rbd unit test failure due to ceph keyring file

This test fails if /etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring
exists.  Mock out isfile() to get the behavior the unit
test expects.

Closes-Bug: #1909109

Change-Id: Ie9fd2a0e14b426c68f7c7a22db590a2d94fa0084

Yea but if you don't trigger them in parallel, this won't ever continue. So i guess we need a better understanding of what's occurring and/or actually parallelizing this via something like tripleo_free"}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-11-16 15:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Yea but if you don't trigger them in parallel, this won't ever
 > continue. So i guess we need a better understanding of what's
 > occurring and/or actually parallelizing this via something like
 > tripleo_free

Ack, not sure how this is meant to be called ultimately so I'm adding Lukas in the review to keep me honest.

My understanding is:
 . When we want to run several "openstack update run --limit <role>" concurrently, we need this review to avoid the concurrent pacemaker stop issue.
 . When we run the update in a single command "openstack update run --limit <role1>,<role2>,<role3>", there is no pacemaker issue as things are purely sequential. In that case, this review changes nothing to the behaviour.

Lukas, is it how you guys plan to run the update concurrently, or am I misunderstanding how you run it?'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-11-17 10:17:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 10:31:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Serialize shutdown of pacemaker nodes

When running minor update in a composable HA, different
roles could run ansible tasks concurrently. However,
there is currently a race when pacemaker nodes are
stopped in parallel [1,2], that could cause nodes to
incorrectly stop themselves once they reconnect to the
cluster.

To prevent concurrent shutdown, use a cluster-wide lock
to signals that one node is about to shutdown, and block
the others until the node disconnects from the cluster.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1791841
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1872404

Change-Id: I0e041c6a95a7f53019967f9263df2326b1408c6f
'}, {'created': '2020-10-22 11:04:16.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Serialize shutdown of pacemaker nodes

When running minor update in a composable HA, different
roles could run ansible tasks concurrently. However,
there is currently a race when pacemaker nodes are
stopped in parallel [1,2], that could cause nodes to
incorrectly stop themselves once they reconnect to the
cluster.

to signals that one node is about to shutdown, and block

commit_message:
Serialize shutdown of pacemaker nodes

When running minor update in a composable HA, different
roles could run ansible tasks concurrently. However,
there is currently a race when pacemaker nodes are
stopped in parallel [1,2], that could cause nodes to
incorrectly stop themselves once they reconnect to the
cluster.

To prevent concurrent shutdown, use a cluster-wide lock
to signals that one node is about to shutdown, and block
the others until the node disconnects from the cluster.

Tested the minor update in a composable HA environment:
  . when run with "openstack update run", every role
    is updated sequentially, and the shutdown lock
    doesn't interfere.
  . when running multiple ansible tasks in parallel
    "openstack update run --limit role<X>", pacemaker
    nodes are correctly stopped sequentially thanks
    to the shutdown lock.
  . when updating an existing overcloud, the new
    locking script used in the review is correctly
    injected on the overcloud, thanks to [3].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1791841
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1872404
[3] I2ac6bb98e1d4183327e888240fc8d5a70e0d6fcb

Closes-Bug: #1904193
Change-Id: I0e041c6a95a7f53019967f9263df2326b1408c6f

commit_message:
Run flake8 using pre-commit

- fixes two issues identified by newer flake8
- upgrades flake8 and keeps it pinned
- removes hacking as this is no longer needed, as pre-commit does
  its own pinning.
- enables us to easily add other linters, pylint would come in
  follow-up

Change-Id: If26234fad0cd982bd7d3dc23c42021b357c6bde9
Related-Bug: #1910543

commit_message:
unit test S3 SigV4Request X-Amz-Content-SHA256 handling

Add unit test to verify that upper case UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD is
preserved in canonical request.

Add unit test to verify checking of X-Amz-Content-SHA256 for
zero content-length requests.

Change-Id: I05aa09064c39517ea80476856412f1b659061b49

Update path of the ovn extensions doc

It was changed after migration of the ovn to neutron repo but
path in the comment wasn't changed.

TrivialFix

messages:
[{'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-08-27 18:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-09-01 12:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(10 comments)

Some questions inline + please fix the linter problems.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-09-01 21:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-09-02 06:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(8 comments)

Thanks, Arun, looks pretty good already!

I have a couple of inline questions. 

My main issue, however, is around the user/admin responsibilities/actions ... I do not get how this would
work in a deployment with nova: what is the sequence of actions the user has to do to get an instance with a special disk layout? And in how far is the Ironic admin involved (beyond setting the driver on the Ironic nodes)?'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-09-02 06:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1 -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2020-09-02 06:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thank you Arun. Few comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 18781, 'date': '2020-09-02 09:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-09-04 03:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-09-04 07:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-09-04 08:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-09-05 09:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Interesting, we did similar thing for unattended windows installation a few years before, winpe is PXEd to the machine as the initial system then using an unattended file to automate the rest installation.
I am not sure ubuntu is anaconda based but it seems using kickstart as well, but from a broad view I am thinking if we could use a more generic word for the new deploy interface, like "unattended", "answerfile" etc? What we are missing for such implementation is basically we need support users providing answerfiles which varies from different OSes, and a mechanism to boot the intial system and pass the answerfile.
heartbeating and status checking is quite different and may need consideration in such case.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-09-11 03:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25733, 'date': '2020-10-22 15:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2020-11-16 04:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

When reading this, I wonder if we should call it something like "Installer deploy interface" or "External installer deploy interface" -- it seems to be there are very little specifics here to Anaconda -- we can just have interface of "we'll send one file, and if you have the proper slugs in it we'll substitute valid bash". This would even leave it open for people to implement callbacks in their own installer automations' language.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-11-17 15:13:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(24 comments)

Thanks! This looks really good. I've got some comments/thoughts inline, but none of that blocks forward movement of this spec in my opinion."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-11-17 15:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-11-19 09:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-11-26 08:42:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

In addition to the clarification around the current support for md devices via cleaning and deploy templates, I was wondering if rather than aiming at an anaconda-only interface if we could have sth slightly more generic which would allow to easily accommodate other methods like Ubuntu's preseed.
I am not clear on how much more complicated this would be, but it may save some refactoring work later."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-12-07 15:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Removing +2 for and changing to -1 to drive visibility for updating per meeting discussion.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-12-16 02:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-12-16 02:25:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-12-16 02:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-12-16 21:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-12-21 20:53:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> In addition to the clarification around the current support for md devices via cleaning and deploy templates, I was wondering if rather than aiming at an anaconda-only interface if we could have sth slightly more generic which would allow to easily accommodate other methods like Ubuntu's preseed.
> I am not clear on how much more complicated this would be, but it may save some refactoring work later.


I am little uneasy about changing the name and making it generic. There will be still things in there that are very specific to anaconda. For example how we pass kickstart file (inst.ks), how we store and process stage2 (squashfs file - different from ramdisk). These are not generic. However we could make a generic interface and derive  AnacondaDeployInterface from that generic Interface. Still it would not make this whole SPEC a generic."}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2020-12-21 20:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> (3 comments)
> 
> When reading this, I wonder if we should call it something like "Installer deploy interface" or "External installer deploy interface" -- it seems to be there are very little specifics here to Anaconda -- we can just have interface of "we'll send one file, and if you have the proper slugs in it we'll substitute valid bash". This would even leave it open for people to implement callbacks in their own installer automations' language.

Just copy pasting what i said to Arne comments :)

I am little uneasy about changing the name and making it generic. There will be still things in there that are very specific to anaconda. For example how we pass kickstart file (inst.ks), how we store and process stage2 (squashfs file - different from ramdisk). These are not generic. However we could make a generic interface and derive  AnacondaDeployInterface from that generic Interface. Still it would not make this whole SPEC a generic.'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2020-12-22 22:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Overall OK, missing some details in a couple of places.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2021-01-05 04:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks Arun, this looks great. Lots of detail! I'm missing how anaconda knows the ironic node's uuid..."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-01-05 22:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-01-06 14:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-01-08 21:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Given the +2s are all from today, will wait until Monday in case others have opinions :)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-01-11 15:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-01-11 23:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add support for anaconda deploy interface

This spec describes implementation of anaconda deploy
interface in ironic.

Change-Id: I10e2b232b402ce23e0a690bca4ccd0de87da4ad4
Story: 2007839
Task: 40774

[{'created': '2021-01-08 09:51:29.000000000', 'message': 'Match Linux and Windows "execute" signature method

Remove "do_decode" input parameter from "utils.execute" method
signature. This input parameter is no longer used.

Despite there is no common API definition for both OS methods
implementations, the methods are imported depending on the running OS.
That means the signature of the implementations should match.

Change-Id: I23c7856efa3968b53608233c05a8ff2491fe68a3
Story: #2007686
Task: #41558
'}]
commit_message:
Match Linux and Windows "execute" signature method

Remove "do_decode" input parameter from "utils.execute" method
signature. This input parameter is no longer used.

Despite there is no common API definition for both OS methods
implementations, the methods are imported depending on the running OS.
That means the signature of the implementations should match.

Change-Id: I23c7856efa3968b53608233c05a8ff2491fe68a3
Story: #2007686
Task: #41558

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-24 17:24:25.000000000', 'message': "api: Drop statistics-style fields from os-hypervisors

Introduce API microversion 2.88, which makes the following changes to
a number of 'os-hypervisors'. Specifically, the following fields are
dropped from both the '/os-hypervisors/detail' (detailed list) and
'/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}' (show) APIs:

- current_workload
- cpu_info
- vcpus
- vcpus_used
- free_disk_gb
- local_gb
- local_gb_used
- disk_available_least
- free_ram_mb
- memory_mb
- memory_mb_used
- running_vms

In addition, the '/os-hypervisors/statistics' API, which provided a
summary of the above stats but for all hypervisors in the deployment, is
dropped entirely.

Part of blueprint deprecate-os-hypervisors

Change-Id: I515e484ade6c6455f82a3067940a418a0d7d965a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-12-07 12:18:31.000000000', 'message': "api: Drop statistics-style fields from os-hypervisors

Change-Id: I515e484ade6c6455f82a3067940a418a0d7d965a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-12-15 17:33:21.000000000', 'message': "api: Drop statistics-style fields from os-hypervisors

a number of 'os-hypervisors'. Specifically, the following fields are
dropped from both the '/os-hypervisors/detail' (detailed list) and
'/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}' (show) APIs:

- current_workload
- cpu_info
- vcpus
- vcpus_used
- free_disk_gb
- local_gb
- local_gb_used
- disk_available_least
- free_ram_mb
- memory_mb
- memory_mb_used
- running_vms

In addition, the '/os-hypervisors/statistics' API, which provided a
summary of the above stats but for all hypervisors in the deployment, is
dropped entirely.

A small tweak to 'tox.ini' that allows us to share some venvs is
included.

Part of blueprint deprecate-os-hypervisors

Change-Id: I515e484ade6c6455f82a3067940a418a0d7d965a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-01-06 11:16:10.000000000', 'message': "api: Drop statistics-style fields from os-hypervisors

Introduce API microversion 2.88, which makes the following changes to
a number of 'os-hypervisors'. Specifically, the following fields are
dropped from both the '/os-hypervisors/detail' (detailed list) and
'/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}' (show) APIs:

- current_workload
- cpu_info
- vcpus
- vcpus_used
- free_disk_gb
- local_gb
- local_gb_used
- disk_available_least
- free_ram_mb
- memory_mb
- memory_mb_used
- running_vms

In addition, the '/os-hypervisors/statistics' API, which provided a
summary of the above stats but for all hypervisors in the deployment, is
dropped entirely.

Finally, the '/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor}/uptime' API, which provided a
similar response to the '/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor}' API but with an
additional 'uptime' field, has been removed in favour of including this
field in the primary '/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor}' API.

A small tweak to 'tox.ini' that allows us to share some venvs is
included.

Part of blueprint modernize-os-hypervisors-api

Change-Id: I515e484ade6c6455f82a3067940a418a0d7d965a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
api: Drop statistics-style fields from os-hypervisors

Introduce API microversion 2.88, which makes the following changes to
a number of 'os-hypervisors'. Specifically, the following fields are
dropped from both the '/os-hypervisors/detail' (detailed list) and
'/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}' (show) APIs:

- current_workload
- cpu_info
- vcpus
- vcpus_used
- free_disk_gb
- local_gb
- local_gb_used
- disk_available_least
- free_ram_mb
- memory_mb
- memory_mb_used
- running_vms

In addition, the '/os-hypervisors/statistics' API, which provided a
summary of the above stats but for all hypervisors in the deployment, is
dropped entirely.

Finally, the '/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor}/uptime' API, which provided a
similar response to the '/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor}' API but with an
additional 'uptime' field, has been removed in favour of including this
field in the primary '/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor}' API.

A small tweak to 'tox.ini' that allows us to share some venvs is
included.

Part of blueprint modernize-os-hypervisors-api

Change-Id: I515e484ade6c6455f82a3067940a418a0d7d965a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Setting available_features for stable branch

available_features for Neutron tempest tests is default to "all" and
used from Victoria to enable/disable tests that has no API extension.
It is added here to make sure that stable gating will not execute these
tests (like for IPv6 metadata in neutron-tempest-plugin or updating
min_bw QoS values for port already attached to VMs)

Change-Id: Id1db503c8842477b0716fb75e953240f7982e74b
Related-Bug: #1882804

commit_message:
Add tempest.api.identity to tempest blacklist

As with tempest.api.network the identity tests have nothing to do with
ceph so lets blacklist them and hopefully reduce runtime.

Change-Id: Ibcda268021b236bc049e21b7ddd9e99a7c24dace

commit_message:
Adding key_size option on the certificate creation

Adding the ability to specifies the private key size
used when creating the certificate. We have defined the
default value the same as we have before 2048 bits.
Also, it'll be able to override the key_size value
per service.

Depends-on: I4da96f2164cf1d136f9471f1d6251bdd8cfd2d0b
Change-Id: Ic2edabb7f1bd0caf4a5550d03f60fab7c8354d65
(cherry picked from commit 97609775297417620ede0436c80156456a6c41da)

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Set target size ratio for pg autoscaling

Set the target size ratio for pg autoscaling to reduce
reduce the amount of scaling up and possibly scaling
down (merging) that is required.

Change-Id: Ia5922433b1bafdd23719269273ef25a6ccf92b52

[{'created': '2021-01-07 14:54:58.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

While at it, we're dropping indirect dependencies from lower-constraints.txt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I3a3a1d1f50237a68574375a8742174a4519f2cc4

commit_message:
Create default network for TestServerAdvancedOps

Noticed another gate failure with:

  {"code": 409, "message": "Multiple possible networks found, use a
   Network ID to be more specific."}

so adding create_default_network = True to the test class.

Partial-Bug: #1844568

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1844568/comments/29

Change-Id: Id4b383f03be4b7d699a00a9ceac798eccb880265

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-16 23:11:41.000000000', 'message': 'Rewrite existing ACL tests with ddt, yaml

For secure-rbac there will need to be a way of testing every endpoint
and method with multiple scopes and roles. This change uses the
existing ACL tests to show how this might be done by defining the
tests with YAML. This is a minimal implementation, a follow-up would
include:
- other method verbs
- other kinds of assert (such as assert response list length)
- a mechanism to skip tests so we can pre-generate stubs for every
  endpoint/method
- tests for every endpoint/method with the existing (soon to be
  deprecated) roles

Change-Id: Ib6e0efd3266e4fb2c5aaf67ef2dfdcc76e6be998
'}]
commit_message:
Rewrite existing ACL tests with ddt, yaml

For secure-rbac there will need to be a way of testing every endpoint
and method with multiple scopes and roles. This change uses the
existing ACL tests to show how this might be done by defining the
tests with YAML. This is a minimal implementation, a follow-up would
include:
- other method verbs
- other kinds of assert (such as assert response list length)
- a mechanism to skip tests so we can pre-generate stubs for every
  endpoint/method
- tests for every endpoint/method with the existing (soon to be
  deprecated) roles

Change-Id: Ib6e0efd3266e4fb2c5aaf67ef2dfdcc76e6be998

commit_message:
Register all hardware_interfaces together

Prevent each driver comming online one at a time. So that
/driver returns nothign until all interfaces are registered

Story: #2008423
Task: #41368

Change-Id: I6ef3e6e36b96106faf4581509d9219e5c535a6d8

commit_message:
Update APT metadata before install debootstrap

There are some scenearios where the Debian package metadata is not
updated and it cannot install the debootstrap package. This change
guarantees that information has been updated.

Change-Id: I2c323a91cd3859632dd283b3b03cf78095e523ba

[{'created': '2021-01-08 16:58:23.000000000', 'message': 'Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make

will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: I1dd906a82e3963d2b4f0497570195885abab0530
'}]
commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: I1dd906a82e3963d2b4f0497570195885abab0530

subject: obj: Include devices in per-worker logger prefixes
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-08 21:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-09 03:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-09 22:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Love the idea, but a little worried about the potential size of the list. Maybe it never gets too long to worry about.

if this is about help in debugging issues and wanting to know what devices a worker was in charge of, what about an info or debug log kine at start of cycle?

Just a thought. Ill have a play on monday, i guess the list can only be ss long as the number of disks in your node.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-11 18:16:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Good point -- this was something I hit in my dinky 5-disk, 5-worker home lab, where I'd have one worker that was way slower and I just wanted to know which disk it was a little more easily. If you've got some setup like 24-bay chassis and only 2 workers, it's gonna suck. Maybe I'll make it a config option or something.

FWIW, we *do* have debug lines for the worker args (https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.26.0/swift/common/daemon.py#L191) but needing to go back and cross-reference logs like that seems kinda dumb when we could just drop more useful identifying information anyway."}]

'}]

commit_message:
Support configdrive when doing ramdisk deploy with redfish-virtual-media

When using Redfish virtual media, it's possible to connect a configdrive
via a free USB slot when the ramdisk deploy is used.

Using Swift as configdrive storage is not supported in this case yet.

Story: #2008380
Task: #41302
Change-Id: Ib847dbfe96072cfe4137388ba88ef133bd7ab186

commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: Idec510b7f2302b6db2fe5aba599e3c258043fee0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-14 18:28:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix other out of memory error for qemu-img convert

qemu-img convert makes a number of allocation requests, and less
common than the "Resource temporarily unavailable" error is
"Cannot allocate memory". The first seems to be largely raised
upon a thread creation for the image conversion, where the first
appears to be on buffer setup on the original process.

Regardless, we should check for both and retry conversion
automatically.

rhbz# 1892773

Change-Id: If435ed0efe034d4bb99f0281ebc73840c0f38fb3
(cherry picked from commit 9be6afc751f0dbc251c4b5eeed71fd3b3659976c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix other out of memory error for qemu-img convert

qemu-img convert makes a number of allocation requests, and less
common than the "Resource temporarily unavailable" error is
"Cannot allocate memory". The first seems to be largely raised
upon a thread creation for the image conversion, where the first
appears to be on buffer setup on the original process.

Regardless, we should check for both and retry conversion
automatically.

rhbz# 1892773

Change-Id: If435ed0efe034d4bb99f0281ebc73840c0f38fb3
(cherry picked from commit 9be6afc751f0dbc251c4b5eeed71fd3b3659976c)

commit_message:
Support Neutron Address Group CRUD

Add support for Neutron address group CRUD operations. Subsequent patches
will be added to use address groups in security group rules.

Change-Id: I3c313fc9329837dde67815901528a34dca98ebcc
Implements: blueprint address-groups-in-sg-rules
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/738274
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/745594

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 10:53:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration from the HA to non-HA routers

In case if during switching HA router to be down, there will be any
failure, router_info will be stored in L3 agent's cache as HaRouter.
In case when next update on the router is migration to non-HA router
this is wrong class and it causes other issues, e.g. with
remove_vip_by_ip_address() which is correct only for HA routers.

This patch fixes that issue by adding check of the router's ha and
distributed flags and update local cache with new router_info class
in case if at least one of those flags don't match.

Change-Id: Ib0d3a501f88c149baea7d715c7cfe5811bc85e4f
Closes-Bug: #1892846
(cherry picked from commit 489e0ead7297e3b17ca2bf8c4bea9701ad14a939)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix migration from the HA to non-HA routers

In case if during switching HA router to be down, there will be any
failure, router_info will be stored in L3 agent's cache as HaRouter.
In case when next update on the router is migration to non-HA router
this is wrong class and it causes other issues, e.g. with
remove_vip_by_ip_address() which is correct only for HA routers.

This patch fixes that issue by adding check of the router's ha and
distributed flags and update local cache with new router_info class
in case if at least one of those flags don't match.

Change-Id: Ib0d3a501f88c149baea7d715c7cfe5811bc85e4f
Closes-Bug: #1892846
(cherry picked from commit 489e0ead7297e3b17ca2bf8c4bea9701ad14a939)

commit_message:
s3api: Make UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD requests work again

Previously, we unconditionally lower-cased the client-provided
X-Amz-Content-SHA256 header, which led to SignatureDoesNotMatch errors
since the client and server didn't agree on the canonical request.

Now, only lower-case the value when making comparisons; leave it alone
for signature-calculation purposes.

Change-Id: I746d8e641c884ccd7838082ff07f958ee101de18
Related-Change: I3d6e2e4542a5ed03a6d31ec0ef4837d1de30a045
Closes-Bug: #1910827

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 11:16:10.000000000', 'message': "api: Normalize exception handling for os-hypervisors

Many of the functions implementing the various 'os-hypervisors'
endpoints share common code. In particular any of these functions
contain calls to both the 'instance_get_all_by_host' and
'service_get_by_compute_host' APIs of 'nova.compute.api.HostAPI' so we
can include instance and service information in the responses. All of
these calls are guarded with exception handlers, but the exceptions
handled differ between resources.

There is one exception we need to care about for
'instance_get_all_by_host': 'HostMappingNotFound', which is raised
because the API is decorated with the 'target_cell' decorator. The
'service_get_by_compute_host' API is also decorated by the
'target_host_cell' decorator, however, it can also raise
'ComputeHostNotFound'. This exception is possible because the
'service_get_by_compute_host' API calls
'nova.objects.Service.get_by_compute_host', which in turns calls
'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.service_get_by_compute_host', via the
'_db_service_get_by_compute_host' helper. Not all of the functions that
called 'service_get_by_compute_host' were correctly guarding against
'ComputeHostNotFound'.

In addition to this, the call to the 'get_host_uptime' API used by the
'/os-hypervisors/uptime' API can raise 'HostNotFound' if the service has
been deleted but the compute node still has to be manually cleaned up.
Conversely, a number of functions were handling 'ValueError' even though
this couldn't realistically be raised by the test.

Resolve all of the above.

Change-Id: Iacabaea31311ae14084b55341608e16e531e6bd5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1646255
"}, {'created': '2021-01-07 17:36:26.000000000', 'message': "api: Normalize exception handling for os-hypervisors

endpoints share common code. In particular any of these functions
contain calls to both the 'instance_get_all_by_host' and
'service_get_by_compute_host' APIs of 'nova.compute.api.HostAPI' so we
can include instance and service information in the responses. All of
these calls are guarded with exception handlers, but the exceptions
handled differ between resources.

There is one exception we need to care about for
'instance_get_all_by_host': 'HostMappingNotFound', which is raised
because the API is decorated with the 'target_cell' decorator. The
'service_get_by_compute_host' API is also decorated by the
'target_host_cell' decorator, however, it can also raise
'ComputeHostNotFound'. This exception is possible because the
'service_get_by_compute_host' API calls
'nova.objects.Service.get_by_compute_host', which in turns calls
'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.service_get_by_compute_host', via the
'_db_service_get_by_compute_host' helper. Not all of the functions that
called 'service_get_by_compute_host' were correctly guarding against
'ComputeHostNotFound'.

In addition to this, the call to the 'get_host_uptime' API used by the
'/os-hypervisors/uptime' API can raise 'HostNotFound' if the service has
been deleted but the compute node still has to be manually cleaned up.
Conversely, a number of functions were handling 'ValueError' even though
this couldn't realistically be raised by the test.

Resolve all of the above.

Change-Id: Iacabaea31311ae14084b55341608e16e531e6bd5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1646255
"}]
commit_message:
api: Normalize exception handling for os-hypervisors

Many of the functions implementing the various 'os-hypervisors'
endpoints share common code. In particular any of these functions
contain calls to both the 'instance_get_all_by_host' and
'service_get_by_compute_host' APIs of 'nova.compute.api.HostAPI' so we
can include instance and service information in the responses. All of
these calls are guarded with exception handlers, but the exceptions
handled differ between resources.

There is one exception we need to care about for
'instance_get_all_by_host': 'HostMappingNotFound', which is raised
because the API is decorated with the 'target_cell' decorator. The
'service_get_by_compute_host' API is also decorated by the
'target_host_cell' decorator, however, it can also raise
'ComputeHostNotFound'. This exception is possible because the
'service_get_by_compute_host' API calls
'nova.objects.Service.get_by_compute_host', which in turns calls
'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.service_get_by_compute_host', via the
'_db_service_get_by_compute_host' helper. Not all of the functions that
called 'service_get_by_compute_host' were correctly guarding against
'ComputeHostNotFound'.

In addition to this, the call to the 'get_host_uptime' API used by the
'/os-hypervisors/uptime' API can raise 'HostNotFound' if the service has
been deleted but the compute node still has to be manually cleaned up.
Conversely, a number of functions were handling 'ValueError' even though
this couldn't realistically be raised by the test.

Resolve all of the above.

Change-Id: Iacabaea31311ae14084b55341608e16e531e6bd5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1646255

commit_message:
Remove tempest deprecated img_dir option

Tempest option scenario.img_dir has been deprecated more than 4 years, it's
time to remove it from devstack.
img_file option should contain the full path to the image.
This patch removes setting of img_dir option and makes img_file
one contain the full path of an image.

Change-Id: I71102095f3603915f0bc7d21f2e18c4eac4e95ec
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710996/
Related-Bug: #1393881

"}, {'created': '2021-01-08 02:15:33.000000000', 'message': 'neutron-server api worker process should names to their role

When multiple API processes need to be launched, use "ProcessLauncher"
(in module oslo_service.service) manage. call "launch_service" with the
num of processes and service instance to real launch. when the
"ProcessLauncher" launch the service, it calls the "start" method of
the service directly without passing any parameters.

Starting API processes, the service object passed in is WorkerService
(in module neutron.wsgi) object. In the current design, pass the "desc"
in call "WorkerService.start", therefore, the desc cannot be set.

This patch move the "desc" parameter to the initialization, when call
"start" method, if set "desc", it will be used first. if not, "desc"
passed in initialization are used. this design solves the problem and
keeps compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1910623

Change-Id: Ia37182e572ac4e9ae83cd03d7008aa42c7ea36c8

commit_message:
neutron-server api worker process should be named to their role

The function of class "ProcessLauncher" is to fork multiple processes.
the function of "WorkerService.start" is provider api service and set
process title according to the parameter desc. when multiple API
processes need to be launched, use "ProcessLauncher" (in module
oslo_service.service) manage. call "ProcessLauncher.launch_service"
with the num of processes and service instance to real launch. when the
"ProcessLauncher" launch the service, it calls the "start" method of
the service directly without passing any parameters.

Starting API processes, the service object passed in is WorkerService
(in module neutron.wsgi) object. In the current design, pass the "desc"
in call "WorkerService.start", therefore, the desc cannot be set.

This patch add the "desc" parameter to the initialization, when call
"start" method, if set "desc", it will be used first. if not, "desc"
passed in initialization are used. this design solves the problem and
keeps compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1910623

Change-Id: Ia37182e572ac4e9ae83cd03d7008aa42c7ea36c8

commit_message:
Add support for updating Block Storage Volume type extra_spec attributes

While the volume_types/ endpoint returns extra_specs and accepts it on
creation it doesn't support updating them through volume_types.  It has
to be updated through the volume_types/extra_specs endpoint.

Change-Id: I5f9d5bcb102c5fd9fe60eb03e218c66f9c49592c

[{'created': '2020-11-11 19:26:14.000000000', 'message': "Add 'server shelve --offload', 'server shelve --wait' options

The '--offload' option allows us to explicitly request that the server
be offloaded once shelved or if already shelved.

The '--wait' option allows us to wait for the shelve and/or offload
operations to complete before returning.

Change-Id: Id226831e3c09bc95c34b222151b27391a844b073
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-11-18 11:36:50.000000000', 'message': "Add 'server shelve --offload', 'server shelve --wait' options

The '--offload' option allows us to explicitly request that the server
be offloaded once shelved or if already shelved.

The '--wait' option allows us to wait for the shelve and/or offload
operations to complete before returning. It is implied if attempting to
offload a server than is not yet shelved.

Change-Id: Id226831e3c09bc95c34b222151b27391a844b073
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-01-08 18:30:17.000000000', 'message': "Add 'server shelve --offload', 'server shelve --wait' options

The '--offload' option allows us to explicitly request that the server
be offloaded once shelved or if already shelved.

The '--wait' option allows us to wait for the shelve and/or offload
operations to complete before returning. It is implied when attempting
to offload a server than is not yet shelved.

Change-Id: Id226831e3c09bc95c34b222151b27391a844b073
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'server shelve --offload', 'server shelve --wait' options

The '--offload' option allows us to explicitly request that the server
be offloaded once shelved or if already shelved.

The '--wait' option allows us to wait for the shelve and/or offload
operations to complete before returning. It is implied when attempting
to offload a server than is not yet shelved.

Change-Id: Id226831e3c09bc95c34b222151b27391a844b073
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

This was recently added to the 'server shelve' command. Add it now for
the 'unshelve' command.

Change-Id: I633dd85b60cf70b4f8610f414d82669dd6a53111
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

Specify doc requirements needs to be moved out from
test-requirements.txt to in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver as announced by
the release team [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html

Change-Id: Iac9a3421c23370f19f57d6aa84c2862ccfce2a94

This commit upgrades versions of kuryr-lib, MarkupSafe and

commit_message:
[cinder] Enable volume backup for iSCSI based volumes

This patchset added the necessary hostPath, hostIpc and
hostNetwork to enable the volume backup for iSCSI based
Cinder volumes.

Change-Id: Ief3cc723650a6c42e24dfd6159c0de6f81e56fce

[{'created': '2021-01-06 14:42:05.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Update instance machine type stash spec

The original spec wanted to introduce a new attribute to the Instance
object when discussions at the PTG had actually been around using the
existing system metadata store for this.

Some simple style nits are also addressed in this change.

Change-Id: I36d3b544afb33cdeb70dc3f2a9e067904ebfac05
'}, {'created': '2021-01-07 11:45:41.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Update instance machine type stash spec

* Replaces references to a new ``hw_machine_type`` Instance object
  attribute with the existing ``system_metadata`` dict. This was
  actually agreed to during the PTG but lost and replaced with the new
  attribute sometime later.

* Drops the move of the hardcoded default machine types into the
  ``[libvirt]/hw_machine_type`` configurable as on review this is not
  actually required to achieve the goals of this spec and would if
  anything make things more complicated when upgrading.

* Lists the new ``nova-manage`` commands and adds ``SHELVED``
  as an allowed vm_state for the ``update_machine_type`` command.

* Lists the default restrictions around updating the machine type via
  the ``update_machine_type`` outside of a full rebuild. These include
  between underlying machine types and from newer to older versions of the
  same machine type.

* Adds a ``--force`` flag to the ``update_machine_type`` command to
  allow operators to workaround these restrictions.

* Drops the reference to the versioned machine types from the data model
  impact section as we are now using ``system_metadata`` that forces us
  to use strings.

* Replaces the incorrect ``SHUTOFF`` vm_state with the correct ``STOPPED``
  state.

* Replaces some incorrect uses of the term deployer and operator/admin
  with operator.

commit_message:
libvirt: Update instance machine type stash spec

* Replaces references to a new ``hw_machine_type`` Instance object
  attribute with the existing ``system_metadata`` dict. This was
  actually agreed to during the PTG but lost and replaced with the new
  attribute sometime later.

* Drops the move of the hardcoded default machine types into the
  ``[libvirt]/hw_machine_type`` configurable as on review this is not
  actually required to achieve the goals of this spec and would if
  anything make things more complicated when upgrading.

* Lists the new ``nova-manage`` commands and adds ``SHELVED``
  as an allowed vm_state for the ``update_machine_type`` command.

* Lists the default restrictions around updating the machine type via
  the ``update_machine_type`` outside of a full rebuild. These include
  between underlying machine types and from newer to older versions of the
  same machine type.

* Adds a ``--force`` flag to the ``update_machine_type`` command to
  allow operators to workaround these restrictions.

* Drops the reference to the versioned machine types from the data model
  impact section as we are now using ``system_metadata`` that forces us
  to use strings.

* Replaces the incorrect ``SHUTOFF`` vm_state with the correct ``STOPPED``
  state.

* Replaces some incorrect uses of the term deployer and operator/admin
  with operator.

Change-Id: I36d3b544afb33cdeb70dc3f2a9e067904ebfac05

[{'created': '2021-01-07 20:19:33.000000000', 'message': "Ensure user is aware upgrade has not happened w/ train

There is a 'hole' in the user experience where if you try to
openstack-upgrade from stein to train but have no already related
placement to the nova-cc unit, then the openstack upgrade is aborted and
a workload message indicates that the relation is needed.

However, if you then subsequently add the placement relation, the
warning goes away, but the payload is not upgraded to match the
openstack-origin value.

This patch adds a warning if the openstack-origin is for train, the
payload is stein, the action-managed-upgrade is false and the placement
relation is made; i.e. that the operator fell into the above hole.

Change-Id: I360f2d72cad374c31ee766065af682e2fa6218d1
Closes-Bug: #1910276

commit_message:
Ensure user is aware upgrade has not happened w/ train

There is a 'hole' in the user experience where if you try to
openstack-upgrade from stein to train but have no already related
placement to the nova-cc unit, then the openstack upgrade is aborted and
a workload message indicates that the relation is needed.

However, if you then subsequently add the placement relation, the
warning goes away, but the payload is not upgraded to match the
openstack-origin value.

This patch adds a warning if the openstack-origin is for train, the
payload is stein, the action-managed-upgrade is false and the placement
relation is made; i.e. that the operator fell into the above hole.

Change-Id: I360f2d72cad374c31ee766065af682e2fa6218d1
Closes-Bug: #1910276

Set warnings category to filter only DeprecationWarnings
and UserWarning

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix haproxy not running and race in zone creation

This change cherry-picks 3 bugfixes at the same time
as they are all needed in order to get the gate green:
- Fix haproxy not running on fresh deployments
- Sync release-tools
- Fix race condition in default zone creation

Sync release-tools boilerplate containing these changes
in order to pin pip < 20.3:
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/125
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/126
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/127
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/129

Also add Groovy to the test gate.

Change-Id: I04ca79487085d9088811bc0ffd5f0981db50c42e
Closes-Bug: #1904411
Closes-Bug: #1905985
(cherry picked from commit a43af5c7e70875386f17fc3043024fd71c318e4a)
(cherry picked from commit 330539066a71e0f6501d7005999635507bf4b977)
(cherry picked from commit f35f3e0392e6b841d3899d522d38bd6b3621277b)

commit_message:
Add config options for expired notifications

Adds config options to configure the notification expiration time
as well as how frequent to check for expired notifications.

Change-Id: I9607f01a800baded37cfc23b6bc9f8e6aecc2d74
Closes-Bug: #1773765
(cherry picked from commit 62bc9c05b9cd438d45067e0efafe6fa75ef5b500)

commit_message:
Add support for iperf action

Support execution of iperf using an action to support
expanded performance testing requirements.

This allows iperf to be run in parallel between multiple
units.

This commit also adds support for collection of metrics
from iperf during testing for collation by Prometheus.

Depends-On: I46f7d3e13c002524bb340988bd6ba163a74ad29c
Change-Id: Ib7d5d268becfb2dc803323a6a3d8b0a2f2eefd04

commit_message:
Use glance-swift.conf by default

This patch changes default of the swift_store_config_file parameter,
so that the configuration file generated by puppet-glance is used by
default, instead of requiring users to set the parameter explicitly.

Closes-Bug: #1908917
Change-Id: I4ac04a561746c227b245d11890d02c14a21965d0
(cherry picked from commit 26e26d115d04f6208f316932f18a9b57bde4867d)
(cherry picked from commit ddb7d4e48ea5fba85b4ae04274d91f7273d4383e)
(cherry picked from commit a15022400a0001e5041381af266adc3ba810d332)

subject: Add doc/requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 16:10:50.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I502983f00ca86ba3739e35bba7024a81a952d7c4
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I502983f00ca86ba3739e35bba7024a81a952d7c4

commit_message:
Use tempest's ServiceClients rather than Manager

tempest.Manager has been deprecated for more than 4 years already
and will be removed by [1].
Tempest plugins are expected to consume
tempest.lib.services.clients.ServiceClients directly.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/767628

Change-Id: Ibd04c38c084f63e9129f0bfef1df988e410695db

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-08 20:28:41.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:Clean up non-durable handoff fragments after reconstructor revert

This is part 1 of a series of patches to ultimately send non-durables
from handoffs to primaries via ssync.  Currently non-durable fragments
on handoffs are neither synced nor removed during a reconstructor
revert job.

In this part, the non-durables are yielded to ssync, but not
synced. ssync then includes them in the collection of fragments that
the reconstructor can clean up, so the non-durable is removed.

Closes-Bug: 1778002
Change-Id: Ie95d00231eaad489af5db9ac341b078afc553610

commit_message:
WIP: ssync: sync non-durable fragments from handoffs (part 1/2)

Clean up non-durable handoff fragments after reconstructor revert

This is part 1 of a series of patches to ultimately send non-durables
from handoffs to primaries via ssync.  Currently non-durable fragments
on handoffs are neither synced nor removed during a reconstructor
revert job.

In this part, the non-durables are yielded to ssync, but not
synced. ssync then includes them in the collection of fragments that
the reconstructor can clean up, so the non-durable is removed.

Closes-Bug: 1778002
Change-Id: Ie95d00231eaad489af5db9ac341b078afc553610

commit_message:
Fix default disk label with partition images

Partition images through the agent have the unfortunate
side effect of being executed without full node context
by default. Luckilly we've had a similar problem and
cache the node.

This patch changes the lookup from a default of msdos
partitions to use the cached node object.

Change-Id: I002816c9372fdf1cc32f3c67f420073551479fd9
(cherry picked from commit cb6c0059b5f5bd428623c461bd69afc793441f7e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-11 10:40:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix lower-constraints job

pip 20.3 finally includes a proper dependency resolver. Its use is
causing the following error messages on the lower-constraints job:

  ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement
  hacking<3.1.0,>=3.0.1
  ERROR: No matching distribution found for hacking<3.1.0,>=3.0.1

Resolve this by moving the 'hacking' and 'flake8-import-order'
dependencies from 'test-requirements.txt' to 'tox.ini' since we don't
need to use our constraints machinery for linters.

While we're here, also drop 'bandit' from 'test-requirements.txt'. This
was introduced in change I691829c1224557d1d239c9f665ac539d0f13c4d3 but
commit f78173f0e1daabccbbe0230fe93df98ac971afbc (there's no change ID)
removed the 'bandit' testenv from 'tox.ini' meaning we no longer use
this anywhere.

Change-Id: I744efd75c4cbf8c630c5f95dc254acff581be959
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints job

pip 20.3 finally includes a proper dependency resolver. Its use is
causing the following error messages on the lower-constraints job:

  ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement
  hacking<3.1.0,>=3.0.1
  ERROR: No matching distribution found for hacking<3.1.0,>=3.0.1

Resolve this by moving the 'hacking' and 'flake8-import-order'
dependencies from 'test-requirements.txt' to 'tox.ini' since we don't
need to use our constraints machinery for linters.

While we're here, also drop 'bandit' from 'test-requirements.txt'. This
was introduced in change I691829c1224557d1d239c9f665ac539d0f13c4d3 but
commit f78173f0e1daabccbbe0230fe93df98ac971afbc (there's no change ID)
removed the 'bandit' testenv from 'tox.ini' meaning we no longer use
this anywhere.

Change-Id: I744efd75c4cbf8c630c5f95dc254acff581be959
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Need to see how it plays with ceph nautilus containers, or containers too getting updated to ceph octopus, ceph guys would have more context around it.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2020-12-28 12:56:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ceph Octopus repository doesn't have ceph-ansible package, If we completely replace nautilius repos with Octopus repos.

Run of install_packages.sh(trying to install during ceph-ansible[1]) fails [2].

We understand in long term ceph-ansible will be replaced by cephadm, but looking at patch [3] which is still a WIP, Looks like we couldn't switch ceph-ansible to cephadm completely yet.

We need more inputs from Ceph Team on this but till then to unblock us we plan to keep ceph nautilius repos as it is and just install cephadm from octopus repo (Looks like atleast package installation will work as we don't noticed any hard dependencies on cephadm and ceph binaries[4])


[1]

~~~
sudo $(command -v dnf || command -v yum) install -y python3-tripleoclient 
~~~

[2]
https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_fe5/768599/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider/fe52e6f/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/install_packages.sh.log

~~~
2020-12-28 12:03:02 | Last metadata expiration check: 0:00:37 ago on Mon 28 Dec 2020 12:02:25 PM UTC.
2020-12-28 12:03:02 | No match for argument: ceph-ansible
2020-12-28 12:03:02 | Error: Unable to find a match: ceph-ansible
~~~

[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/767294

[4] 

~~~
$ rpm -qp --requires https://cbs.centos.org/kojifiles/packages/ceph/15.2.5/1.el8/x86_64/cephadm-15.2.5-1.el8.x86_64.rpm
/bin/sh
/bin/sh
/usr/libexec/platform-python
lvm2
python3
rpmlib(CompressedFileNames) <= 3.0.4-1
rpmlib(FileDigests) <= 4.6.0-1
rpmlib(PayloadFilesHavePrefix) <= 4.0-1
rpmlib(PayloadIsXz) <= 5.2-1
~~~"}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2020-12-28 13:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2020-12-28 14:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-12-28 14:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2020-12-28 14:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-12-28 14:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Add octopus repos in master release file

With this patch we are updating master release file to add ceph
octopus repository in addition of ceph nautilus repository.

We haven't disabled ceph nautilus repos because ceph-ansible is not
present in Octopus repos. For now we are keeping ceph nautilius repos
as it is and just installing cephadm from octopus repo.

Once switch from ceph-ansible to cephadm is complete, We will remove
ceph nautilus repo and pull all the packages from Octopus repository.

This is with reference to patch [1] where we added Ceph octopus
repository when the release is W+.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-repos/+/766683
Closes-Bug: #1909191

Change-Id: I2efd7080e7fd2922c7f18ab49ad7aca502a6c3ac

commit_message:
Document the new CephConfigPath option

This change is supposed to document the CephConfigPath option
introduced by the TripleO Ceph client role.
The purpose of this doc change is to make the operators aware
that this option changes in tripleo-heat-templates the default
location of the rendered keyfiles and ceph.conf within the host,
leaving untouched the mountpoint inside the containers.

Change-Id: I2dbedb715097206ed62aae32c83af9fc19932bd1

commit_message:
Ensure valid configuration before zone creation

Check that the 'mon' context was listed as complete prior to
attempting to undertake any type of zone configuration.

This should ensure that the ceph.conf file is complete.

Change-Id: I6a55e46422a19ea27193518a41a48b768b980212
Closes-Bug: 1905985

commit_message:
Handle the extended ceph-access relation

If more than a single Ceph key is set as part of the relation data,
make sure that all of them are configured.

Makes sure that the previous relation data is handled as well
in order to maintain backwards compatibility.

Co-authored-by: Ionut Balutoiu <ibalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Change-Id: I24be0ed48edd5af517e1699df77ef0d96ef20aa2

commit_message:
Drop lower constraints testing

Projects like oslo are dropping lower constraints
testing. There is also discussion to drop it until
we find a proper setup. For details, please follow
the ML thread. TC will have updates soon.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019679.html

story: 2008482
task: 41523

Change-Id: I3dc8e22505556a1142681210af1342d2a9fb29d7
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Microversion 2.88: Replace tenant* with project* in quota* commands

This patch replaced 'tenant_id' with 'project_id' in below commands:

- ``nova quota-defaults``
- ``nova quota-show``
- ``nova quota-delete``
- ``nova quota-update``

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/768851
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/769120

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

commit_message:
Drop lower constraints testing

Projects like oslo are dropping lower constraints
testing. There is also discussion to drop it until
we find a proper setup. For details, please follow
the ML thread. TC will have updates soon.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019679.html

story: 2008482
task: 41523

Change-Id: Icb162f918176465911148b35af3714c46cc2327f
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Set dhcp_domain for all nova services

This is required for nova-compute so move to init.pp from metadata.pp and set
DEFAULT/dhcp_domain (which nova should undeprecate) vs api/dhcp_domain.

Change-Id: If6a26527a737a7184ebddd5b4bc346d64827e9e3
Related-bug: #1903908
Related-bug: #1832537
(cherry picked from commit 71276558e77c8612397d0e31187cc8eec4554ff9)

subject: Correct certificate request SAN IP addresses
messages:
[{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-01-07 21:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-01-08 00:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Investigating the failure.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-01-08 00:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is because using cert_utils.get_certificate_requests we do not get the "127.0.0.1" address in the SAN IPs. The client sides connecting to local mysql-routers use 127.0.0.1 but still need to validate the certificate.

I need to think on what the best approach is.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-01-08 16:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-01-08 17:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-10 14:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2021-01-11 11:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 21:30:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use cert_utils.get_certificate_requests

Remove custom certificate request elements and use the standard
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.cert_utils.get_certficate_requests.

Pass bindings to get_certificate_requests and create_ip_cert_links to
guarantee all SAN IPs are included.

Landing this change will build the charm with updated charm-helpers and
charms.openstack which will close LP Bug#1908306.

Change-Id: Id9ca8aae6538c70295e5c4c9720fa8a001a11bcd
Close-Bug: #1908306
'}, {'created': '2021-01-08 16:02:31.000000000', 'message': 'Correct certificate request SAN IP addresses

Prior to this change the charm incorrectly used the
cluster_peer_addresses property. This change uses the cluster_address,
db_router_address and shared_db_address properties when requesting
certificates SAN IPs.

Pass bindings to create_ip_cert_links to guarantee all SAN IPs are
included.

Landing this change will build the charm with updated charm-helpers
and charms.openstack which will close LP Bug#1908306.

Change-Id: Id9ca8aae6538c70295e5c4c9720fa8a001a11bcd
Close-Bug: #1908306
'}]
commit_message:
Correct certificate request SAN IP addresses

Prior to this change the charm incorrectly used the
cluster_peer_addresses property. This change uses the cluster_address,
db_router_address and shared_db_address properties when requesting
certificates SAN IPs.

Pass bindings to create_ip_cert_links to guarantee all SAN IPs are
included.

Landing this change will build the charm with updated charm-helpers
and charms.openstack which will close LP Bug#1908306.

Change-Id: Id9ca8aae6538c70295e5c4c9720fa8a001a11bcd
Close-Bug: #1908306

commit_message:
Use glance-swift.conf by default

This patch changes default of the swift_store_config_file parameter,
so that the configuration file generated by puppet-glance is used by
default, instead of requiring users to set the parameter explicitly.

Closes-Bug: #1908917
Change-Id: I4ac04a561746c227b245d11890d02c14a21965d0
(cherry picked from commit 26e26d115d04f6208f316932f18a9b57bde4867d)
(cherry picked from commit ddb7d4e48ea5fba85b4ae04274d91f7273d4383e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-02 03:20:13.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate support for networking-cisco

Unfortunately networking-cisco[1] has not been updated for recent two
years. It supports only Python 2.7 and 3.5 according to its setup.cfg,
and looks very outdated.
Let's deprecate its support since we don't expect any users still using
it with recent OpenStack releases.

[1] https://opendev.org/x/networking-cisco/

Change-Id: I8ccfd7ab762c66510e282ed29bcc8e8539997897
"}, {'created': '2021-01-02 11:24:32.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate support of networking-cisco

Unfortunately networking-cisco[1] has not been updated for recent two
years, and it still supports only Python 2.7 and 3.5 according to its
setup.cfg file.
Let's deprecate support of the plugin since we don't expect any users
still using that outdated plugin with recent OpenStack releases.

[1] https://opendev.org/x/networking-cisco/

Change-Id: I8ccfd7ab762c66510e282ed29bcc8e8539997897
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate support of networking-cisco

Unfortunately networking-cisco[1] has not been updated for recent two
years, and it still supports only Python 2.7 and 3.5 according to its
setup.cfg file.
Let's deprecate support of the plugin since we don't expect any users
still using that outdated plugin with recent OpenStack releases.

[1] https://opendev.org/x/networking-cisco/

Change-Id: I8ccfd7ab762c66510e282ed29bcc8e8539997897

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Can we just add these two backlist job into ceph-iscsi job?
> ceph-iscsi ci job: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/667108

Use option 'tempest_black_regex' to skip un-support tests.Bellow regex should be OK.

tempest_black_regex："(.*\.test_force_detach_volume)|(.*\.test_volume_from_snapshot_cascade_delete)"
see: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/667108/24/.zuul.yaml#184

Then we can abandon this change.'}]

(1 comment)

I tried that patch on Ubuntu 20.04 but devstack is failing for me with error like:

```
+lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent:_start_process:190  sudo systemctl enable ovn-northd.service
The unit files have no installation config (WantedBy=, RequiredBy=, Also=,
Alias= settings in the [Install] section, and DefaultInstance= for template
units). This means they are not meant to be enabled using systemctl.

Possible reasons for having this kind of units are:
• A unit may be statically enabled by being symlinked from another unit's
  .wants/ or .requires/ directory.
• A unit's purpose may be to act as a helper for some other unit which has
  a requirement dependency on it.
• A unit may be started when needed via activation (socket, path, timer,
  D-Bus, udev, scripted systemctl call, ...).
• In case of template units, the unit is meant to be enabled with some
  instance name specified.
```

So I think that this may be related to that change :)"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-12-03 13:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-12-03 16:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-12-03 16:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I tried that patch on Ubuntu 20.04 but devstack is failing for me with error like:
> 
> ```
> +lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent:_start_process:190  sudo systemctl enable ovn-northd.service
> The unit files have no installation config (WantedBy=, RequiredBy=, Also=,
> Alias= settings in the [Install] section, and DefaultInstance= for template
> units). This means they are not meant to be enabled using systemctl.
> 
> Possible reasons for having this kind of units are:
> • A unit may be statically enabled by being symlinked from another unit's
>   .wants/ or .requires/ directory.
> • A unit's purpose may be to act as a helper for some other unit which has
>   a requirement dependency on it.
> • A unit may be started when needed via activation (socket, path, timer,
>   D-Bus, udev, scripted systemctl call, ...).
> • In case of template units, the unit is meant to be enabled with some
>   instance name specified.
> ```
> 
> So I think that this may be related to that change :)

Thanks Slaweq, 

I was able to reproduce the issue after a few tries, I believe the problem was that in Ubuntu there's a "ovn-central.service" service file which is used to start both northd and the OVN DBs in the right order. So I changed the code on Ubuntu to use it. 

Note that on CentOS the ovn-northd.service is the service file that does it, there's no ovn-central.service there.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-12-07 09:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 16:01:50.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Use OVN from packages

This patch changes the OVN module from DevStack to allow for using the
OSapackaged version of OVN instead of compiling it from source.

A new variable called OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE has been introduced and when
set to False (the default value) OVN will then use the packaged version
for setting up DevStack.

Change-Id: Ib41e3b486550200572afd6b3ba783d7644d70d44
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

for setting up DevStack.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764318
Change-Id: Ib41e3b486550200572afd6b3ba783d7644d70d44
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-12-03 16:48:41.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Use OVN from packages

This patch changes the OVN module from DevStack to allow for using the
OSapackaged version of OVN instead of compiling it from source.

A new variable called OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE has been introduced and when
set to False (the default value) OVN will then use the packaged version
for setting up DevStack.

Note, in the stop_ovn() function, the OVN metadata agent service name
was wrong and the service wasn't being stopped as part of ./unstack.sh.
This patch also fixed it as well.

Change-Id: Ib41e3b486550200572afd6b3ba783d7644d70d44
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

A new variable called OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE has been introduced and when
set to False (the default value) OVN will then use the packaged version
for setting up DevStack.

Note, in the stop_ovn() function, the OVN metadata agent service name
was wrong and the service wasn't being stopped as part of ./unstack.sh.
This patch also fixed it as well.

Change-Id: Ib41e3b486550200572afd6b3ba783d7644d70d44
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Use OVN from packages

This patch changes the OVN module from DevStack to allow for using the
OSapackaged version of OVN instead of compiling it from source.

A new variable called OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE has been introduced and when
set to False (the default value) OVN will then use the packaged version
for setting up DevStack.

Note, in the stop_ovn() function, the OVN metadata agent service name
was wrong and the service wasn't being stopped as part of ./unstack.sh.
This patch also fixed it as well.

Change-Id: Ib41e3b486550200572afd6b3ba783d7644d70d44
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP/DNM libvirt: Increase device detach wait times

We are seeing various Focal based jobs fail due to disks not detaching
within the instance guestOS in time. This is a shot in the dark to see
if increasing time between and the overall number of retries to detach a
device helps reduce these failures given the small amount of resource
afforded to each instance the overall test hosts.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734700/
Change-Id: I8328b9c3d35b8aa931d902287fa7f5c795e3ad47
Related-Bug: #1882521

commit_message:
Increase upper constraint of puppetlabs-xinetd

The highest version that fits current constraint is 1.5.0, which is > 5
years old[1]. Increase the version so that newer version can be
installed.

The options used for xinetd::service are all present in the newest
version (v3.3.0) of xinetd, so this should be fine.

[1]: https://forge.puppet.com/modules/puppetlabs/xinetd/1.5.0

Change-Id: Id31370dbc69361f6857e9c9825d7fe1c430954e0

commit_message:
Microversion 2.88: Replace tenant* with project* in usage* commands

This patch replaced 'tenant_id' with 'project_id' in below commands:

- ``nova usage``
- ``nova usage-list``

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/768852
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/769120
part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: I39a57a5cd8c3e7ba340dba50d430043d4f84c683

commit_message:
Fix operating status for empty UDP pools

Fix empty UDP pools status: a UDP pool without members went OFFLINE
instead of ONLINE.

This commit changes the keepalived configuration with empty pools:
the configuration now contains a virtual_server and a comment about the
existing pool. This comment is used by the get_udp_listener_pool_status
to detect that the pool exists and is not offline.

Story 2007984
Task 40610

Change-Id: I30e23ca13d033d77c8ebdabbfdc7b54556a9466b

subject: K8S Services: add support for SCTP
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}, {'_account_id': 27032, 'name': 'Maysa de Macedo Souza', 'email': 'maysa.macedo95@gmail.com', 'username': 'maysa'}, {'_account_id': 28182, 'name': 'Jiaping LI', 'email': 'lijiaping@yovole.com', 'username': 'lijiaping'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-12-23 13:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-12-23 13:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-12-23 17:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks, Tabitha. Here goes a few things that needs tweak:

We need to ensure the correct Exception (octavia.common.exceptions.ProviderUnsupportedOptionError) is handled when SCTP protocol is not supported on Octavia. Note that when SCTP is not supported, Kuryr would keep retrying to create the listener and ends up raising a ResourceNotReady exception[1] which will keep restarting the Kuryr-controller[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py#L729-L732
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/801265/'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-12-23 21:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Thanks, Tabitha. Here goes a few things that needs tweak:
> 
> We need to ensure the correct Exception (octavia.common.exceptions.ProviderUnsupportedOptionError) is handled when SCTP protocol is not supported on Octavia. Note that when SCTP is not supported, Kuryr would keep retrying to create the listener and ends up raising a ResourceNotReady exception[1] which will keep restarting the Kuryr-controller[2].
> 
> [1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py#L729-L732
> [2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/801265/

Thanks Maysa, will do.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-12-23 22:23:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Just a side note, in order to check if the connectivity is really allowed when using SCTP for a Service, it's needed to create a Pod serving a SCTP application (till now the ones used by Kuryr only serve over TCP/UDP), then expose (create a Service with SCTP) this Pod and attempt to connect from another Pod to the created Service over SCTP.

One example of a Pod serving with SCTP is the following http://paste.openstack.org/show/801271/, the image used is agnhost https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/images/agnhost/README.md ."}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-12-23 22:48:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Just a side note, in order to check if the connectivity is really allowed when using SCTP for a Service, it's needed to create a Pod serving a SCTP application (till now the ones used by Kuryr only serve over TCP/UDP), then expose (create a Service with SCTP) this Pod and attempt to connect from another Pod to the created Service over SCTP.
> 
> One example of a Pod serving with SCTP is the following http://paste.openstack.org/show/801271/, the image used is agnhost https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/images/agnhost/README.md .

I was thinking I might have to create a sample application, but this is better. Thank you ;)"}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-12-24 14:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-12-24 22:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks for the update. Besides handling the exception that might be raised, we should also avoid listeners+pools creation with SCTP if the Octavia version does not supports it. Similar to how its done when checking if Octavia support double listeners https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/8ceb35d56f6978492872d70ee92281b742dd99f0/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/loadbalancer.py#L590.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-12-24 23:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:
