If not specified, it will be 30, so it wouldn't need to be explicit and this change wouldn't need to be necessary, as per my understanding. Being explicit doesn't hurt though. Could you please clarify? I might be missing something"}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-04 10:48:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Hi Alex. I'm confused on whether this change is even needed, as this code seems to be already addressing the issue: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/550/commits/04caff991bdaaef58e3fd1355e5037742836e2c5#diff-607b489182324a53f9975edd49a9fc07904f147412ecea7eecb75eee17fe016eR100
> 
> If not specified, it will be 30, so it wouldn't need to be explicit and this change wouldn't need to be necessary, as per my understanding. Being explicit doesn't hurt though. Could you please clarify? I might be missing something

There's always a risk with default parameters; it's much better to use an explicit parameter, rather than rely on the default as the default may change in the library.  e.g. it may change to disable the timeout.  Here we definitely want the timeout.  Also it kind of guarantees that the timeout parameter exists (i.e. the charm is using the library with the feature) and the unit-test locks in the idea of the timeout (so stops it being removed by accident)."}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2021-01-04 16:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2021-01-04 16:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yea being explicit is good, my confusion was whether the code change was technically needed for the fix to work. thanks for the clarification!'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-01-08 10:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 21:58:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add connect_timeout to MySQLHelper.connect call

If the local mysql router fails to connect (or work) with the clustered
MySQL8 instance, then the MySQLHelper.connect() call will hang
indefinitely.  Unfortunately, this happens during an update-status hook,
which is not visible (due to juju status not showing update-status hooks
executing).  Although this has no impact on the running cloud, it does
mean that nothing else happens on the machine (update-status, upgrades,
hooks, config-changed, etc.).  This allows the connect to fail and thus
for the charm to go into error so that the local mysql router instance
can be restarted.

Note that this depends on [1] landing in charm-helpers.

[1]: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/550

Closes-bug: #1907250
Change-Id: I030d7caa8cc41aaf89ade25e5be196fb602d466c
'}]
commit_message:
Add connect_timeout to MySQLHelper.connect call

If the local mysql router fails to connect (or work) with the clustered
MySQL8 instance, then the MySQLHelper.connect() call will hang
indefinitely.  Unfortunately, this happens during an update-status hook,
which is not visible (due to juju status not showing update-status hooks
executing).  Although this has no impact on the running cloud, it does
mean that nothing else happens on the machine (update-status, upgrades,
hooks, config-changed, etc.).  This allows the connect to fail and thus
for the charm to go into error so that the local mysql router instance
can be restarted.

Note that this depends on [1] landing in charm-helpers.

[1]: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/550

Closes-bug: #1907250
Change-Id: I030d7caa8cc41aaf89ade25e5be196fb602d466c

Ensure that python3 really is installed on upgrade charm

During a switch from py2 to py3, need to ensure that the required
python3 versions of the required libraries are installed.

If Docker starts first, it gets stuck in a starting state waiting
for the kuryr service to become available. This change swaps the

Change-Id: Ib2395c317c34cfbd4b72b1d19932a236bcff7a30
(cherry picked from commit 1a75a7dfbe9345fa795965fea947237d2e8bec80)
'}]
commit_message:
defaults: start kuryr service before docker

If Docker starts first, it gets stuck in a starting state waiting
for the kuryr service to become available. This change swaps the
order to start kuryr first instead.

Change-Id: Ib2395c317c34cfbd4b72b1d19932a236bcff7a30
(cherry picked from commit 1a75a7dfbe9345fa795965fea947237d2e8bec80)

commit_message:
Clean up create_disk() a little

The create_disk() helper had some redundant checks and dead code. This
refactors it to put all the stale cleanup at the top, and groups the
new actions together with more relevant comments to make it easier
to understand.

Change-Id: I1f6218a1994e66786ed9a8065e30bcceec7b8956

commit_message:

3 other release jobs. It makes sense to make Stein job at least
non-voting.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for master

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

  -https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Idac38dc3b55d4eda6e3e8347722abfc9d6782183

subject: Ensure cluster and db-router bindings are in cert
messages:
[{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2020-12-18 14:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-12-20 03:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I legitimately think the bug comes down to
 req.add_hostname_cn_ip(instance.cluster_peer_addresses + ["127.0.0.1"])
vs
 req.add_hostname_cn_ip(instance.cluster_addresses + ["127.0.0.1"])
and we can add instance.db_router_address.

We might consider moving the logic out of the reactive handler into the charm object method instance.get_certificate_requests. Or not.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-01-04 11:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> (4 comments)
> 
> I legitimately think the bug comes down to
>  req.add_hostname_cn_ip(instance.cluster_peer_addresses + ["127.0.0.1"])
> vs
>  req.add_hostname_cn_ip(instance.cluster_addresses + ["127.0.0.1"])
> and we can add instance.db_router_address.
> 
> We might consider moving the logic out of the reactive handler into the charm object method instance.get_certificate_requests. Or not.

Fixing instance.cluster_peer_addresses gets you passed the first issue, the change to charmhelpers ,that this change depends on, and the change here to pass an augmented address map are needed to fix subsequent bugs.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-01-08 09:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by a change by thedac'}]

commit_message:
Ensure cluster and db-router bindings are in cert

When requesting a certificate ensure that the IP addresses
associated with db-router and cluster bindings are included in
the certificate request.

When the charm receives the certificate ensure symlinks for the
db-router and cluster IP addresses are created.

Closes-Bug: #1908306
Depends-On: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/551
Change-Id: I73539b8ef10f6d285a7ee00472829d873e055719

commit_message:
Add trusted.gpg to the copy_from_host list for 20.04

Without this, installing containers on a host that uses a non-default repo
source will fail.

Change-Id: Ib50b8a85cddcfffcfa54dc39580f92f7305c7c4a
(cherry picked from commit 47df1aa66990f4dbb83bd07d1a328af06be5cf57)

[{'created': '2020-12-11 12:59:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inconsistencies in lower-constraints

Pip 20.3 starts to check requirements of all installed python libraries
are compatibile. It detects some inconsistencies in lower-constraints.
This commit fixes them.

* alembic min version is bumped to match oslo.db requirements.
* oslo.messaging 7.0.0 and kombu 4.6.1 in lower-constraints are
  incompatible. oslo.messaging requirement is bumped to 12.5.0
  (which is a branch point of stable/victoria).
* The min versions of oslo.messaging dependencies are updated accordingly.
* bandit 1.6.3 is actually used. The min version is bumped to match this.
* PyYAML lower-constraint is bumped to 5.3.1 to match bandit requirements.

Change-Id: I29f5e77ca6ded86248963fae68719ccbaab7c242
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistencies in lower-constraints

Pip 20.3 starts to check requirements of all installed python libraries
are compatibile. It detects some inconsistencies in lower-constraints.
This commit fixes them.

* alembic min version is bumped to match oslo.db requirements.
* oslo.messaging 7.0.0 and kombu 4.6.1 in lower-constraints are
  incompatible. oslo.messaging requirement is bumped to 12.5.0
  (which is a branch point of stable/victoria).
* The min versions of oslo.messaging dependencies are updated accordingly.
* bandit 1.6.3 is actually used. The min version is bumped to match this.
* PyYAML lower-constraint is bumped to 5.3.1 to match bandit requirements.

Change-Id: I29f5e77ca6ded86248963fae68719ccbaab7c242

subject: Add NB_Global get method
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-14 09:42:32.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add NB Global get parameter method

STILL UNDER DEVELOPMENT

Change-Id: I7f31ee368ad26acd80ebbbd5ffce2fc0fc5eb25a
Related-Bug: #1888878
'}, {'created': '2020-11-14 15:53:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add NB_Global get parameter method

Retrieve a parameter from the NB_Global single row. This table must
have only one single register.

In case the parameter given is not present in the row,
"AttributeError" exception will be raisen.

This method is based on "BaseCommand". The client using this
implementation will be constrain to the OVSDB connection lock
enforced in the API, instead of accessing directly to the
in-memory DB cache. That could lead to sync errors as reported
in the related bug.

Change-Id: I7f31ee368ad26acd80ebbbd5ffce2fc0fc5eb25a
Related-Bug: #1888878
'}, {'created': '2020-11-14 17:01:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add NB_Global get method

Retrieves, from the NB_Global table, the first and only row that
should be present. If "parameter" is passed, only the column
matching to this input variable will be returned.

In case the parameter given is not present in the row,
"AttributeError" exception will be raisen.

This method is based on "BaseCommand". The client using this
implementation will be constrain to the OVSDB connection lock
enforced in the API, instead of accessing directly to the
in-memory DB cache. That could lead to sync errors as reported
in the related bug.

Change-Id: I7f31ee368ad26acd80ebbbd5ffce2fc0fc5eb25a
Related-Bug: #1888878
'}]
commit_message:
Add NB_Global get method

Retrieves, from the NB_Global table, the first and only row that
should be present. If "parameter" is passed, only the column
matching to this input variable will be returned.

In case the parameter given is not present in the row,
"AttributeError" exception will be raisen.

This method is based on "BaseCommand". The client using this
implementation will be constrain to the OVSDB connection lock
enforced in the API, instead of accessing directly to the
in-memory DB cache. That could lead to sync errors as reported
in the related bug.

Change-Id: I7f31ee368ad26acd80ebbbd5ffce2fc0fc5eb25a
Related-Bug: #1888878

Please keep in mind: 1. runs using bhs1.ovh or ca-ymq-1.vexxhost were only sometimes getting problematic PyPI indices while the incident persisted, and 2. the PyPI maintainers are aware of the problem and may have already addressed it. Because of both of those, an example success run doesn't really tell us much. You're basically optimizing for a failure which may never occur again because of the solutions PyPI is planning to implement before they reenable the problem system."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-10-03 15:52:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Cap setuptools to 44.1.1 with Python 2.7

This is a workaround until some CI servers update the pypi cache.
This will enforce the installation of the higher setuptools version
supported with Python 2.7 when installing pip.

Change-Id: I1404bf13ef795de400cb490cdd68a944aef56840
Related-Bug: #1898178

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-03 15:27:31.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail when depth is greater than rbd_max_clone_depth

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would
be allowed by the previous, higher setting) could no longer
be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would

be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241
(cherry picked from commit 8d8d242c3924037e6774a681efabce4893a26646)

commit_message:
Do not fail when depth is greater than rbd_max_clone_depth

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would
be allowed by the previous, higher setting) could no longer
be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241
(cherry picked from commit 8d8d242c3924037e6774a681efabce4893a26646)
(cherry picked from commit 23a821b2a4bbb5696bc27044a455fc7837641111)
(cherry picked from commit f6e5fe187ea947fd7d4624a4f456dd7e11c35c7d)

commit_message:
Make sure that available_features is empty

available_features for Neutron tempest tests is used from Victoria to
enable/disable tests that has no API extension.
It is added here to make sure that stable gating will not execute these
tests (like for IPv6 metadata in neutron-tempest-plugin or updating
min_bw QoS values for port already attached to VMs)

Change-Id: Id1db503c8842477b0716fb75e953240f7982e74b
Related-Bug: #1882804

commit_message:
Add trusted.gpg to the copy_from_host list for 20.04

Without this, installing containers on a host that uses a non-default repo
source will fail.

Change-Id: Ib50b8a85cddcfffcfa54dc39580f92f7305c7c4a
(cherry picked from commit 47df1aa66990f4dbb83bd07d1a328af06be5cf57)

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

swift-multinode-rolling-upgrade is also made non-voting in order for
this change to land as we cannot deploy from stable/train without this
change.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/768256
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/768257
Closes-Bug: #1907438
Change-Id: I294d5350e2f418614e54ff7bdd47dff16bfdcdbc

commit_message:
Raise error when old network config templates are used

When using 'NetworkConfigWithAnsible: False', users still need to
convert the old heat config templates using SoftwareConfig
resources with [1]. Raise a proper error rather than the
current AttributeError.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/master/tools/convert_nic_config.py

Change-Id: Ie7a97fd9dae85870db3c41d60f376934b089044c

commit_message:
Set DeployIndentifier early in tripleoclient-parameters.yaml

We can set the heat parameters in the client itslef and there
would be no need to update plan environment and can get rid of
the ansible tasks for those.

Same applies for RootStackName.

Also, removes multiple redundant calls to _update_parameters()

Change-Id: I54762eb6881113c67744207f53fd92cf003e0559

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-30 10:38:09.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix inconsistent IGMP configuration

Prior to this patch the IGMP configuration for ML2/OVN was inconsistent
with the configuration option description and also the ML2/OVS driver
because it was flooding traffic to unregistered VMs [0].

The "igmp_snooping_enable" configuration option says:

"Setting this option to True will also enable Open vSwitch
mcast-snooping-disable-flood-unregistered flag. This option will disable
flooding of unregistered multicast packets to all ports."

But, in ML2/OVN that behavior was inconsistent prior to this patch
because it allowed traffic to flood to unregistered VMs. This patch
fixes it.

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
      neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/neutron/conf/agent/ovs_conf.py#L36-L47

Change-Id: I5cbe09e26120905b29351d61bbadb30b5dd14938
Closes-Bug: #1904399
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9dc8bca7401106313cb227cb85d07eba7d987cb5)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix inconsistent IGMP configuration

Prior to this patch the IGMP configuration for ML2/OVN was inconsistent
with the configuration option description and also the ML2/OVS driver
because it was flooding traffic to unregistered VMs [0].

The "igmp_snooping_enable" configuration option says:

"Setting this option to True will also enable Open vSwitch
mcast-snooping-disable-flood-unregistered flag. This option will disable
flooding of unregistered multicast packets to all ports."

But, in ML2/OVN that behavior was inconsistent prior to this patch
because it allowed traffic to flood to unregistered VMs. This patch
fixes it.

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
      neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/neutron/conf/agent/ovs_conf.py#L36-L47

Change-Id: I5cbe09e26120905b29351d61bbadb30b5dd14938
Closes-Bug: #1904399
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9dc8bca7401106313cb227cb85d07eba7d987cb5)

commit_message:
Allow disabling image_params_prepare task

This patch introduces a new parameter, disable_image_params_prepare, to
plan management tasks, so that operators can disable the task to
prepare image parameters during overcloud deployment.
This is useful when operators use an environment file to list all
container images with explicit tags used in deployment.

Related-Bug: #1896757
Change-Id: I278299f8f20c6b70eb3f26780f7454319059a12f
(cherry picked from commit a2632456c1269e86de2da834811f2250a46094c5)

commit_message:
Update for a podman_container from collection

And remove docker.io from podman container tests.

Podman has conflicts with installed containerd.io and
block train jobs. Stop installing docker for podman roles.

(cherry picked from commit b6ca89d194aeb428e58f680a43c4bef700b96831)
Change-Id: I5d4d2b3ab3ac209f93146268f50f624588037d82

commit_message:
Add retries to push

We're seeing issues storing layers in the local registry for the content
providers. Let's add a retry to the push logic to see if that makes it
more reliable.

Change-Id: I297cc0a2c2242b020b662184d24436f59ea5c3f9
Related-Bug: #1908844

commit_message:
Get back py36 to tox envlist

Current openstack-wallaby-jobs will run python 3.6 job
on bionic. However we don't have the env in tox definition,
then that results into no unit tests run on the job.

Let's get back py36 to the envlist until we drop bionic/py36

Change-Id: Ic8f66e48619fe2c367fe4612fbe0184b74a7ff06

commit_message:
compute: Add missing options for 'server list'

This accepts a large number of options that we weren't exposing. Add the
following options: '--availability-zone', '--key-name',
'--config-drive' and '--no-config-drive', '--progress', '--vm-state',
'--task-state' and '--power-state'.

In addition, refine the 'openstack server list --status' parameter to
restrict users to the actual choices supported by the server.

Change-Id: Ieeb1f22df7092e66a411b6a36eafb3e16efc2fc2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615

Closes-Bug: #1907438
Change-Id: I294d5350e2f418614e54ff7bdd47dff16bfdcdbc

commit_message:
trivial: Use plural for appended parameters

Multiple compute commands take a '--property' parameter or variant
thereof. These should be stored in a 'properties' (plural) dest for
sanity's sake. Correct this.

Change-Id: If393836925fa736404527d9abd212b8ac9931027
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
compute: Fix 'hypervisor show -f yaml' output

The 'cpu_info' field returned by the 'os-hypervisors' API is an object
and should be formatted as such.  However, this is complicated by the
fact that the object in this field is stringified until microversion
2.28 and is only returned as an actual object on later microversions.
Handle the conversion from the string for older microversions and
display things correctly for all releases.

Change-Id: Ide31466cbb9e89c96d6bd542fe039ab5ed1fac1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Yeah, I think watchers were where I noticed this first -- I was scratching my head about why the prefix wasn't showing up for my NameError on a typo or something ;-)

I've also noticed it in multiprocess replicators, though, where you get a message like `Error syncing with node: ...` that includes info on the destination but nothing about the source."}]

commit_message:
compute: Add 'server show --topology' option

Add support for compute microversion 2.78 by adding a '--topology'
option to 'openstack server show' command that retrieves server NUMA
information.

Change-Id: Ie22979df2ea9082ca64a4d43b571bd4025684825

commit_message:
compute: Fix 'server group * -f yaml' output

Make use of 'FormattableColumn'-derived formatters, which provide better
output than what we were using before, particularly for the YAML output
format.

Change-Id: Id6d25a0a348596d5a0430ff7afbf87b049a76bc8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
compute: Fix 'usage * -f yaml' output

Make use of 'FormattableColumn'-derived formatters, which provide better
output than what we were using before, particularly for the YAML output
format.

Change-Id: Ic770f27cb1f74222636f05350f97400808adffbf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 31825, 'date': '2021-01-03 08:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-01-05 23:22:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Thanks Xinxin Shen. Whereas we are saving some CI resources by dropping the testing for Python 3.7; if we do test with Python 3.6 and Python 3.8, it would be safer to test versions in between as well. I read that others have similar concerns, so I'll wait to discuss on the mailing list (http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html) before reviewing this."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-01-05 23:35:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My last comment seems confusing so, correcting it: we do test Python 3.6 and Python 3.8 (we drop 3.7 testing to save CI cycles), that is good enough to believe Python 3.7 works, but that doesn't mean we should drop Python 3.7 from the classifiers :)"}, {'account_id': 31825, 'date': '2021-01-08 00:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
remove py37

Remove python3.7 from setup.cfg, since Wallaby's python
supported runtimes are python 3.6 and python 3.8[1]:

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html

Change-Id: I867a5332cb808b747333db4e3d3158cb90cf9039

commit_message:
remove py37

Remove python3.7 from setup.cfg, since Wallaby's python
supported runtimes are python 3.6 and python 3.8[1]:

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html

Change-Id: I84a087baa69d67e436642d0fd77444aa24228ca8

[{'created': '2020-12-18 09:47:26.000000000', 'message': 'Use bind mounts for tls certificates

partial backport from train to use bind mounts for certificates.
The UseTLSTransportForNbd is not available in queens.

Certificates get merged into the containers using kolla_config
mechanism. If a certificate changes, or e.g. UseTLSTransportForNbd
gets disabled and enabled at a later point the containers running
the qemu process miss the required certificates and live migration
fails.
This change moves to use bind mount for the certificates and in
case of UseTLSTransportForNbd ans creates the required certificates even
if UseTLSTransportForNbd is set to False. With this UseTLSTransportForNbd
can be enabled/disabled as the required bind mounts/certificates
are already present.

Related-Bug: #1900986
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1888951

Conflicts:
  deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I7f583d18e558b95922a66eb539cc91de74409c96
(cherry picked from commit e07e571ba205097a23d9dc4e1fb9a6645351c248)
(cherry picked from commit 6e59a84ec0082b17b54acbc0374700217a3f684b)
(cherry picked from commit a2510a5e149733244f0c97ec07f3f81ff50ac174)
'}]
commit_message:
Use bind mounts for tls certificates

partial backport from train to use bind mounts for certificates.
The UseTLSTransportForNbd is not available in queens.

Certificates get merged into the containers using kolla_config
mechanism. If a certificate changes, or e.g. UseTLSTransportForNbd
gets disabled and enabled at a later point the containers running
the qemu process miss the required certificates and live migration
fails.
This change moves to use bind mount for the certificates and in
case of UseTLSTransportForNbd ans creates the required certificates even
if UseTLSTransportForNbd is set to False. With this UseTLSTransportForNbd
can be enabled/disabled as the required bind mounts/certificates
are already present.

Related-Bug: #1900986
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1888951

Conflicts:
  deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I7f583d18e558b95922a66eb539cc91de74409c96
(cherry picked from commit e07e571ba205097a23d9dc4e1fb9a6645351c248)
(cherry picked from commit 6e59a84ec0082b17b54acbc0374700217a3f684b)
(cherry picked from commit a2510a5e149733244f0c97ec07f3f81ff50ac174)

commit_message:
Wire up new tripleo upgrades jobs template

The depends-on adds a new upgrade jobs template which is wired up
here. Once wired up across tripleo we can remove excess content
providers with [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/769131
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761188

Change-Id: I3ac185c37428499048a8927b7e3c4766d0a53f74

commit_message:
Wire up new tripleo upgrades jobs template

The depends-on adds a new upgrade jobs template which is wired up
here. Once wired up across tripleo we can remove excess content
providers with [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/769131
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761188

Change-Id: I64f6b74763fb9de3813e4558ce176851e479f30f

I tested an external deployment using this patch and the new role for ceph client configuration. Two observations:

1. ceph-ansible doesn't configure the client but it still runs; it does harmless tasks so it's OK, but it would be nice in a follow up patch to get rid of these unnecessary tasks just to make the overall run faster (perhaps more skip tags?)

 http://paste.openstack.org/show/800315/

2. ceph.conf not configured correctly. This is more important. I'll look into why.

 http://paste.openstack.org/show/800314/"}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-11-23 16:57:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> 1. ceph-ansible doesn't configure the client but it still runs; it does harmless tasks so it's OK, but it would be nice in a follow up patch to get rid of these unnecessary tasks just to make the overall run faster (perhaps more skip tags?)

> 2. ceph.conf not configured correctly. This is more important. I'll look into why.
> 
>  http://paste.openstack.org/show/800314/

ack thanks, I see you have empty values for fsid and mon host.
In theory this role is expecting to see those values coming from
```
CephClusterFSID: 'xyz'
CephClientKey: 'xyz=='
CephExternalMonHost: 'ip1,ip2,ip3'
```
and they are resolved as described here [1] (via external_cluster_mon_ips and fsid variables).

Can you take a look the the config-download dir and see if they're set and how?
Not sure we need extra logic to take care of the external use case scenario

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/758039/41/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_client/templates/ceph_conf.j2"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-11-24 18:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Cool, thanks for testing it.
As you can see from the last CI run, for example in scenario004, the path customization worked as expected, and containers uses /etc/ceph files coming from the /var/lib/tripleo-config/ceph!

Manila [1]
Glance [2]
Nova [3]

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-12-01 13:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

This patch will need to add the following:

    - OS::TripleO::Services::CephClient

to the following:

 https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/master/roles/Controller.yaml

as well as these:

 ControllerAllNovaStandalone.yaml
 ControllerNovaStandalone.yaml
 ControllerOpenstack.yaml
 ControllerSriov.yaml
 ControllerStorageDashboard.yaml
 ControllerStorageNfs.yaml

This is because the CephClient service was omitted because a Ceph server would be deployed
on the same container host and the client and server containers both mounted /etc/ceph.
With this patch we move containers which are ceph clients to getting their ceph config from
/var/lib/tripleo-config/ceph so the configuration from /etc/ceph is no longer sufficient.

I did a test to confirm with the depends-on patches both with and without the additional
CephClient service and without it Glance containers flap because they miss their ceph config
which is resolved by adding the service.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-01 15:43:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

>  ControllerSriov.yaml
>  ControllerStorageDashboard.yaml
>  ControllerStorageNfs.yaml
> 
> This is because the CephClient service was omitted because a Ceph server would be deployed
> on the same container host and the client and server containers both mounted /etc/ceph.
> With this patch we move containers which are ceph clients to getting their ceph config from
> /var/lib/tripleo-config/ceph so the configuration from /etc/ceph is no longer sufficient.
> 
> I did a test to confirm with the depends-on patches both with and without the additional
> CephClient service and without it Glance containers flap because they miss their ceph config
> which is resolved by adding the service.

+1 Thanks for confirming it. I'm going to update this patch with the missing service"}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-01 15:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-01 15:55:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

'}, {'created': '2020-11-02 18:20:36.000000000', 'message': "Disable ceph client role execution

This change adds a bool to prevent the ceph-ansible client role being
executed.
When this boolean is true, the 'ceph_ansible_limit' option is set and
an exclude list containing the 'clients' section is built.
By doing this, ceph-ansible shouldn't run the client role [1] because
no hosts are matched.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/site-container.yml.sample#L269

Depends-on: Ia1d629b13d87debb4d3d297d5dbfcd31a6ef4c3d
Change-Id: I784e6a476752ed701192b3a0155c42edd4836d97

Depends-on: Ia1d629b13d87debb4d3d297d5dbfcd31a6ef4c3d

"}, {'created': '2020-11-09 17:02:54.000000000', 'message': "(WIP) - Disable ceph client role execution

This change adds a bool to prevent the ceph-ansible client role being
executed.
When this boolean is true, the 'ceph_ansible_limit' option is set and
the 'clients' section will be excluded.
Then, to make sure all the use cases are covered, the 'ceph_client' tag
is is added to the list of tasks that should be skipped in ceph-ansible.
By doing this, ceph-ansible shouldn't run the client role [1].

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/site-container.yml.sample#L269

Change-Id: I784e6a476752ed701192b3a0155c42edd4836d97
"}, {'created': '2020-11-09 17:21:33.000000000', 'message': "(WIP) - Disable ceph client role execution

This change adds a bool to prevent the ceph-ansible client role being
executed.
When this boolean is true, the 'ceph_ansible_limit' option is set and
the 'clients' section will be excluded.
Then, to make sure all the use cases are covered, the 'ceph_client' tag
is is added to the list of tasks that should be skipped in ceph-ansible.
By doing this, ceph-ansible shouldn't run the client role [1].

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/site-container.yml.sample#L269

Change-Id: I784e6a476752ed701192b3a0155c42edd4836d97
"}, {'created': '2020-11-16 06:50:20.000000000', 'message': "Disable ceph client role execution

This change adds a bool to prevent the ceph-ansible client role being
executed.
When this boolean is true, the 'ceph_client' tag is added to the list
of tags that should be skipped in ceph-ansible.
By doing this, ceph-ansible won't run the client role [1] and the new,
tripleo_ceph_client role is imported and executed.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/site-container.yml.sample#L269

Depends-On: Ia60bc6d5d1a04bd560f2fcb05a4b64078015ae9d

'}, {'created': '2020-12-08 22:15:17.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Configure Ceph clients via tripleo-ceph-client (not ceph-ansible)

Default CephAnsibleSkipClient to True and CephConfigPath to
/var/lib/tripleo-config/ceph (instead of /etc/ceph) and set
these paramters explicitly in scenario00{1,4}. This will
result in all Ceph client configuration being done not by
ceph-ansible but by the new tripleo-ceph-client role from
tripleo-ansible.

Add the CephClient service to all Controller* roles which will
use Ceph. The service could have always been there as there are
Ceph clients on the these controllers, but it was not because
ceph-ansible configured clients as a side effect. With new
CephConfigPath default they no longer overlap so the service
is required.

Add support for CephExternalMultiConfig via tripleo-ceph-client
by looping on the contents of the CephExternalMultiConfig list
and passing each map as the dcn variable while including the
tripleo-ceph-client role each time.

Related-Bug: #1708302
Depends-On: I938ab604859fda88f3491399444841a3a373d162
Change-Id: I784e6a476752ed701192b3a0155c42edd4836d97

commit_message:
Configure Ceph clients via tripleo-ceph-client (not ceph-ansible)

Default CephAnsibleSkipClient to True and CephConfigPath to
/var/lib/tripleo-config/ceph (instead of /etc/ceph) and set
these paramters explicitly in scenario00{1,4}. This will
result in all Ceph client configuration being done not by
ceph-ansible but by the new tripleo-ceph-client role from
tripleo-ansible.

Add the CephClient service to all Controller* roles which will
use Ceph. The service could have always been there as there are
Ceph clients on the these controllers, but it was not because
ceph-ansible configured clients as a side effect. With new
CephConfigPath default they no longer overlap so the service
is required.

Add support for CephExternalMultiConfig via tripleo-ceph-client
by looping on the contents of the CephExternalMultiConfig list
and passing each map as the dcn variable while including the
tripleo-ceph-client role each time.

Related-Bug: #1708302
Depends-On: I938ab604859fda88f3491399444841a3a373d162
Change-Id: I784e6a476752ed701192b3a0155c42edd4836d97

commit_message:
Wire up new tripleo upgrades jobs template

The depends-on adds a new upgrade jobs template which is wired up
here. Once wired up across tripleo we can remove excess content
providers with [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/769131

Change-Id: I97aa46ebc6d472f68fdf38cff92bacecc109a05d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-04 17:24:04.000000000', 'message': "Ensure no rebalance during ceph update if docker is updated.

When docker is updated, a full restart of ceph-osd is triggered. It's
because there is a systemd dependency on docker service in ceph-osd
service definition.

Make sure we set the necessary flag to avoid any rebalance action, all
the time.

Note that we don't check for docker restart. That's to avoid code
duplication and because setting/unsetting those flags shouldn't hurt
even when docker is not updated.

Docker is restarted at step 2 and yum upgrade happens at step 3, so we
choose step 1 for setting the flags and step 4 (to be on the safe
side) to unset them.

Queens-Only because it happens only when using docker.

Change-Id: If7ebd5b0fed0c84b720729e1e75f659bae2355fe
Closes-Bug: #1910124
"}, {'created': '2021-01-05 17:54:50.000000000', 'message': "Ensure no rebalance during ceph update if docker is updated.

the time.

Note that we don't check for docker restart. That's to avoid code
duplication and because setting/unsetting those flags shouldn't hurt
even when docker is not updated.

Docker is restarted at step 2 and yum upgrade happens at step 3, so we
choose step 1 for setting the flags and step 4 (to be on the safe
side) to unset them.

Queens-Only because it happens only when using docker.

Change-Id: If7ebd5b0fed0c84b720729e1e75f659bae2355fe
Closes-Bug: #1910124
"}, {'created': '2021-01-05 22:11:01.000000000', 'message': "Ensure no rebalance during ceph update if docker is updated.

Change-Id: If7ebd5b0fed0c84b720729e1e75f659bae2355fe
Closes-Bug: #1910124
"}, {'created': '2021-01-06 18:03:52.000000000', 'message': '[Queens] Handle ceph service restart during update.

Since this change[1] in ceph-ansible the ceph services are stopped if
docker is stopped. This happens during the update steps when docker
needs to be updated[2].

This in turn breaks the update in several ways.

To avoid any problem, when docker need a restart, we:
 1. make sure we restart the ceph services if docker was stopped;
 2. set the necessary flags so that no rebalance action happens when
    osd services are stopped.

To achieve this we make sure to set the docker restart related facts
in steps 0 so that they are available for step1,2,4.

I resuffle the when conditional on top of the blocks to work around
lp#1910418.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/5444
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/stable/queens/puppet/services/docker.yaml#L178-L184

Queens-Only because it happens only when using docker.

Change-Id: If7ebd5b0fed0c84b720729e1e75f659bae2355fe
Closes-Bug: #1910124
'}, {'created': '2021-01-06 18:34:56.000000000', 'message': '[Queens] Handle ceph service restart during update.

This in turn breaks the update in several ways.

To avoid any problem, when docker need a restart, we:

To achieve this we make sure to set the docker restart related facts
in steps 0 so that they are available for step1,2,4.

For the flag we also set "run_once" so that setting the flags happens
only once if the ceph-osd are updated in batch[3].

I resuffle the when conditional on top of the blocks to work around
lp#1910418.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/5444
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/stable/queens/puppet/services/docker.yaml#L178-L184
[3] Shouldn't be the default as osd should be updated serially, but it's cleaner this way.

Queens-Only because it happens only when using docker.

Change-Id: If7ebd5b0fed0c84b720729e1e75f659bae2355fe
Closes-Bug: #1910124
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens] Handle ceph service restart during update.

Since this change[1] in ceph-ansible the ceph services are stopped if
docker is stopped. This happens during the update steps when docker
needs to be updated[2].

This in turn breaks the update in several ways.

To avoid any problem, when docker need a restart, we:
 1. make sure we restart the ceph services if docker was stopped;
 2. set the necessary flags so that no rebalance action happens when
    osd services are stopped.

To achieve this we make sure to set the docker restart related facts
in steps 0 so that they are available for step1,2,4.

For the flag we also set "run_once" so that setting the flags happens
only once if the ceph-osd are updated in batch[3].

I resuffle the when conditional on top of the blocks to work around
lp#1910418.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/5444
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/stable/queens/puppet/services/docker.yaml#L178-L184
[3] Shouldn't be the default as osd should be updated serially, but it's cleaner this way.

Queens-Only because it happens only when using docker.

Change-Id: If7ebd5b0fed0c84b720729e1e75f659bae2355fe
Closes-Bug: #1910124

commit_message:
Fix support for policy.yaml

This change solves the following two problems we have with support of
policy.yaml.
  - Use proper default content according to file format
  - Use proper updates to manipulate yaml files

Also, name of the resource to manage a policy rule is updated by this
change so that duplicated keys are detected and result in errors.

Change-Id: I6309319d6133501d78b61b9c572e684d334c2f3a

commit_message:
Restrict Ansible dependency

This patch adds some version specifiers in the molecule-requirements.txt
to restrict to specific Ansible release.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I39283d724864230ebd504d662cbfd377a533cdc6

commit_message:
Add possibility to set logging source for Horizon

This patch adds HorizonLoggingSource parameter to enable fluentd to tail logs
from Horizon.

To keep consistency with other services the default value is set as single log located
in appropriate log directory, but we also need to enable customer to pass multiple
horizon log files also used by httpd.

Change-Id: I0161e6d9c76424b301e48b73f1d7b4b071af0676
(cherry picked from commit f2fc8c8fafd1c29c8ddfa0c78b875cb9f48291a7)

commit_message:
Add possibility to set logging source for Horizon

This patch adds HorizonLoggingSource parameter to enable fluentd to tail logs
from Horizon.

To keep consistency with other services the default value is set as single log located
in appropriate log directory, but we also need to enable customer to pass multiple
horizon log files also used by httpd.

Change-Id: I0161e6d9c76424b301e48b73f1d7b4b071af0676
(cherry picked from commit f2fc8c8fafd1c29c8ddfa0c78b875cb9f48291a7)

[{'created': '2020-11-10 11:52:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix MetricsQdrUseSSL value

puppet-qdr expects one of the string values 'yes'/'no' instead of boolean,
so currently listeners cannot be created with SSL enabled. This patch is fixing
this issue.

Change-Id: I2dbafdc417f31eb000fbb469ae2c082cda3a5523
(cherry picked from commit dfc3322b637c62b85f450d2ad4aab0aaa1990cb7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix MetricsQdrUseSSL value

puppet-qdr expects one of the string values 'yes'/'no' instead of boolean,
so currently listeners cannot be created with SSL enabled. This patch is fixing
this issue.

Change-Id: I2dbafdc417f31eb000fbb469ae2c082cda3a5523
(cherry picked from commit dfc3322b637c62b85f450d2ad4aab0aaa1990cb7)

subject: Allow branchless repo to release EM tag
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-26 19:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-26 20:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28182, 'date': '2020-12-27 10:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-12-30 12:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

We have never marked these -em before, and I don't really think we should. There is nothing here to "extend maintenance" on. The last real tag is the marker we've gone by to know what coincided with which stable release. This is mixing concepts that do not go together.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-12-30 12:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-30 19:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> We have never marked these -em before, and I don't really think we should. There is nothing here to "extend maintenance" on. The last real tag is the marker we've gone by to know what coincided with which stable release. This is mixing concepts that do not go together.

These were -em tagged in rocky[1] but those were with wrong hash[2].

Why we need -em tag for Tempest and its plugins:
Tempest and its plugins (which are branchless) master version does not support the EM branches[3] so we need to release a tag for those EM to use it for their testing until they move to Unmaintained. If we do not release a EM tag for tempest and plugins then it is not easy to maintained their CI testing. I have faced a lot of issue in past due to this. I have explained the versioning things for Tempest and its plugins here- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1]https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/08361a137a2b9709ada79893bdcc0433abbc9fcd/deliverables/rocky/neutron-tempest-plugin.yaml#L21

[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/709901/4/deliverables/rocky/neutron-tempest-plugin.yaml

[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-30 19:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-30 19:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-04 09:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > We have never marked these -em before, and I don't really think we should. There is nothing here to "extend maintenance" on. The last real tag is the marker we've gone by to know what coincided with which stable release. This is mixing concepts that do not go together.
> 
> These were -em tagged in rocky[1] but those were with wrong hash[2].
> 
> Why we need -em tag for Tempest and its plugins:
> Tempest and its plugins (which are branchless) master version does not support the EM branches[3] so we need to release a tag for those EM to use it for their testing until they move to Unmaintained. If we do not release a EM tag for tempest and plugins then it is not easy to maintained their CI testing. I have faced a lot of issue in past due to this. I have explained the versioning things for Tempest and its plugins here- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
> 
> [1]https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/08361a137a2b9709ada79893bdcc0433abbc9fcd/deliverables/rocky/neutron-tempest-plugin.yaml#L21
> 
> [2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/709901/4/deliverables/rocky/neutron-tempest-plugin.yaml
> 
> [3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Hello,

Thanks for the details.

On a semantical point of view I agree with Sean, it can look weird to tag branchless project as -em, Sean is right this is mixing concepts, but if it can help to manage testing on stale branches it does not shock me to tag these projects as -em. I missed that point on my previous review on the related patches.

I don't have all the design's history of -em and which rules are the rule in this case, but I can see that we also tagged queens and ocata as -em in the past ( https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/tag/queens-em ), however I can't find rocky, maybe the job failed due to the wrong sha...

Anyway I'm not against to continue with -em on branchless as did on the past, but first lets ask if we have an other option to maintain their CI testing? If the response is no, then I think that we should continue with that. Any idea?

If we decide to continue with these changes I think that we will face another issue with our tooling/process, especially with EOL. Recently we introduced a script to detect EOL stale branches, and I'm afraid that these changes will be a first step towards the EOL path with branchless projects, and here we will face an issue with our shared process with the infra team (removing of EOL branches on a branchless projects).

Before moving further with these change I think we need some discussions with all the team and even with the infra team to see the benefits and the risk to follow this path.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-07 17:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-01-07 17:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 2:
> > > 
> > > (1 comment)
> > > 
> > > We have never marked these -em before, and I don't really think we should. There is nothing here to "extend maintenance" on. The last real tag is the marker we've gone by to know what coincided with which stable release. This is mixing concepts that do not go together.
> > 
> > These were -em tagged in rocky[1] but those were with wrong hash[2].
> > 
> > Why we need -em tag for Tempest and its plugins:
> > Tempest and its plugins (which are branchless) master version does not support the EM branches[3] so we need to release a tag for those EM to use it for their testing until they move to Unmaintained. If we do not release a EM tag for tempest and plugins then it is not easy to maintained their CI testing. I have faced a lot of issue in past due to this. I have explained the versioning things for Tempest and its plugins here- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
> > 
> > [1]https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/08361a137a2b9709ada79893bdcc0433abbc9fcd/deliverables/rocky/neutron-tempest-plugin.yaml#L21
> > 
> > [2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/709901/4/deliverables/rocky/neutron-tempest-plugin.yaml
> > 
> > [3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
> 
> Hello,
> 
> Thanks for the details.
> 
> On a semantical point of view I agree with Sean, it can look weird to tag branchless project as -em, Sean is right this is mixing concepts, but if it can help to manage testing on stale branches it does not shock me to tag these projects as -em. I missed that point on my previous review on the related patches.
> 
> I don't have all the design's history of -em and which rules are the rule in this case, but I can see that we also tagged queens and ocata as -em in the past ( https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/tag/queens-em ), however I can't find rocky, maybe the job failed due to the wrong sha...
> 
> Anyway I'm not against to continue with -em on branchless as did on the past, but first lets ask if we have an other option to maintain their CI testing? If the response is no, then I think that we should continue with that. Any idea?

If no em tag then we need to manually try and find the compatible version at our CI/CD as well as in production testing also. I did the same when rocky testing was broken with master version and I need to find compatible Tempest hash/version and for plugins also.


> 
> If we decide to continue with these changes I think that we will face another issue with our tooling/process, especially with EOL. Recently we introduced a script to detect EOL stale branches, and I'm afraid that these changes will be a first step towards the EOL path with branchless projects, and here we will face an issue with our shared process with the infra team (removing of EOL branches on a branchless projects).

This should not impact the EOL decision, if any of the EM stable release move to EOL then we do not need to release new tag for Tempest or plugins as this em tag can be used as last compatible and tested version. That is how it will be used for production cloud testing too.

> 
> Before moving further with these change I think we need some discussions with all the team and even with the infra team to see the benefits and the risk to follow this path.
> 
> Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-01-07 17:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

just as a reminder: this is not needed anymore, as not *-em tag, but rather *-last tag will be used for as tempest support indicator.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-01-07 18:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> just as a reminder: this is not needed anymore, as not *-em tag, but rather *-last tag will be used for as tempest support indicator.

yeah, we can abandon this now as we discussed in release meeting to use *-last for tempest and plugins
- http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/releaseteam/2021/releaseteam.2021-01-07-17.00.log.html#l-46'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-01-07 21:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

defining new tag for branchless EM https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821'}]

commit_message:
Allow branchless repo to release EM tag

Tempest and its plugins are branchless but
need to release the EM tag
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019565.html

This commit allow to tag EM for branchless repo with
latest hash.

Change-Id: Id575b270e3e3299bf191619bf7e0c9fe8d42a7f4

source will fail.

messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-12-14 20:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-07 21:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nDropping in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/769439'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-14 20:22:21.000000000', 'message': 'Use local py2 upper-constraints

The global upper constraints repo will no longer track py2 packages,
meaning upper constraints for the py2.7 runtime will need to be handled
locally.

This adds an in-repo file for upper constraints enforcement using the
last py27 constraints from openstack/requirements to validate
functionality.

Change-Id: I624f914c6155178cbe474f1eae2871e2aef721eb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f2da2aee6805afbdadfd1e8fa8e993cd6a0196d)
'}]
commit_message:
Use local py2 upper-constraints

The global upper constraints repo will no longer track py2 packages,
meaning upper constraints for the py2.7 runtime will need to be handled
locally.

This adds an in-repo file for upper constraints enforcement using the
last py27 constraints from openstack/requirements to validate
functionality.

Change-Id: I624f914c6155178cbe474f1eae2871e2aef721eb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f2da2aee6805afbdadfd1e8fa8e993cd6a0196d)

commit_message:
Don't install docker on centos 8

Podman has conflicts with installed containerd.io and
block train jobs. Stop installing docker for podman roles.

Change-Id: Ib260ade7e1c871729ec788e6a242a6f6b139b73d

commit_message:
Update requirements and lower-constraints

Major changes:
- python-cinderclient 3.3.0 -> 7.2.0 (update to victoria client)
- os-brick 2.5.0 -> 4.1.0 (update to first wallaby brick release)

Other changes to satisfy dependencies for the above.

commit_message:
Fix localization for horizon container

There's a macro that removes localization data from containers in
order to save space. In order to install localized web apps it
has to be moved the app installed and then moved back

also the packages were being installed twice I also fixed that

It was being done only for openstack-dashboard before now I changed to do
that for all UI web apps.

Closes-Bug: 1905250

/1905250

Change-Id: I66cb4fa785a28cc0a30711ffe834e210c11c7f89
(cherry picked from commit 956c0a2ee67f24ca29c431a7b58c0c9ccbc44f81)

commit_message:
[ffwd] Disable scheduling on computes before upgrade

When testing OCP on OSP it was noticed that our automation is too
crude and does not disable scheduling on upgraded computes. This
results with few dead workloads that got scheduled on the compute
right before the upgrade.

Change-Id: I02243028a5ba3c6450e7633740fcfd757d9b20b6
Resolves: UPG-2447
(cherry picked from commit c4193adc62a613c2dafad711dbe0e331e44b2578)

commit_message:
[ffwd] Don't run healthcheck on redis if it's not present

Redis might not be present on the deployment so we shouldn't
check it's status post upgrade.

Change-Id: Ie11acbf29fc8b9025756b5516fe2d9b4326b5425
Resolves: UPG-2446
(cherry picked from commit 87c31a948b88d978b9b0c2dd252e73eee35eb8ae)

commit_message:
Host evacuate dynamic limit

Instead of hardcoded 120 seconds limit we wait 60 + 60 * VMs of
the compute for the evacuation.

Change-Id: I95e7feef641e7107c349e4d1185f88b2e57eb143
(cherry picked from commit 5ddecd46e063a65a2b49ccacd01a0e4f4cc594d0)

messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2021-01-06 07:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-01-07 13:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 07:38:56.000000000', 'message': "Update container-config-scripts/ folder content before update_tasks.

Currently, multiple scripts are being stored in
/var/lib/container-config-scripts directory if any of theses scripts
are being used during the update_tasks the content won't be up to
date (or the script will be fully missing if added in a new release),
as the content of this folder is being updated during the deploy tasks
(step 1), which occurs after all the update_tasks.

This patch gathers the tasks responsible for the folder creation and
content update into a new playbook named common_container_config_scripts.yaml,
this way we can reference the tasks from the deploy-tasks step1 playbook
(as it was happening up to now) and invoke them before the update_tasks
playbook gets called.

Change-Id: I2ac6bb98e1d4183327e888240fc8d5a70e0d6fcb
Related-Bug: #1904193
(cherry picked from commit bb8cb15d20c1d61be92a68ac8fe840e5d6fe1584)
"}]
commit_message:
Update container-config-scripts/ folder content before update_tasks.

Currently, multiple scripts are being stored in
/var/lib/container-config-scripts directory if any of theses scripts
are being used during the update_tasks the content won't be up to
date (or the script will be fully missing if added in a new release),
as the content of this folder is being updated during the deploy tasks
(step 1), which occurs after all the update_tasks.

This patch gathers the tasks responsible for the folder creation and
content update into a new playbook named common_container_config_scripts.yaml,
this way we can reference the tasks from the deploy-tasks step1 playbook
(as it was happening up to now) and invoke them before the update_tasks
playbook gets called.

Change-Id: I2ac6bb98e1d4183327e888240fc8d5a70e0d6fcb
Related-Bug: #1904193
(cherry picked from commit bb8cb15d20c1d61be92a68ac8fe840e5d6fe1584)

commit_message:
[Validator Show] Properly throwing an exception for unknown validation

When running validator show subcommand with a non-existing validation,
the subcommand was outputting multiple tracebacks instead of giving a
simple message to the user.

The patch adds a proper management result when displaying informations
of a non-existing validation.

Change-Id: If7ef6eb53fe1de66a3a21424ed4e64318e680dd0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb6839a7022b90873d5adc770413548b2b9b6c86)

(1 comment)

there's quite a bit of plumbing going on here.  Since the controllers are created for each request I wonder if we should just look at sticking the policy in an attribute on the controller the same way we do with account, container, and obj.

I know that object versioning (soon to be extracted [1]) and COPY (might eventually be extracted [2]) have to do a dance to move the controller instances attributes around so it can make multiple calls into itself for different objects and would have to be updated to do the same thing with policy but that's sort of an existing problem.

... anyway just an idea, might be more work, or it look cleaner.

At a minimum if you're going to do the plumbing, I'd go ahead and nab the policy object out of the collection earlier and just plumb the policy object through instead of the policy_index.

1) any one of those other methods might eventually want to bifurcate behavior based on the storage policy, so it'll be handy to have it already parsed

2) using None as a default for the container and account paths through these common methods, is probably easier to reason about than the default of 0.

Neat idea I think, makes a lot of sense for doing different affinity settings depending on the regions in the storage policy's rings.

Regardless of the implementation you'll want to start working on a test that validates sorting_method behavior depending on the configured value and then make it validate a different behavior depending on the option set on the policy with patch_policies."}, {'account_id': 14966, 'date': '2015-03-04 13:36:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

I think defaulting to the legacy policy might be safe enough?  Maybe the container_info already has a setdefault that will force it to 0.  It's the case where a policy index is set that doesn't exist in *this* proxies swift.conf that's the scariest.  

I think rolling the two phase policy rollout is really starting to look like the best thing.  You push out deprecated (so that before anyone tries to use it everyone will know what it is) - then when the enable rolls out least everyone knows what to do.

So maybe just returning some sort of error is better than guessing and getting it wrong?  I suppose current behavior would end up using the legacy policy ring and letting the reconciler sort it out - in which case maybe this is no worse."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2015-03-17 00:33:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Still think this is a cool idea, got a couple of issues that *could* be addressed in a follow up if someone else was keen to get this in I'll come back and +A with a dependent change.

I think we'd really be happier with a policy attribute than plumbing the policy kwarg further - but I know that that will be easier after version middleware and copy extraction.  Maybe we should prioritize those ahead of this?  OTOH, this is a nice feature and won't make it much harder to de-policy-kwarg the rest of the controller methods later if we are able to get it as an attribute.

Most of the test changes are incidental - a consequence of the signature change of the base controller methods.  So it'd be really nice to see a strong set of tests for sort_nodes.  Let me know if I didn't explain myself well enough on how to make the one related test you updated better validate the behavior change here - and I'll try and throw out a diff.

Do you think you could crib the check_config validator from the proxy server to ensure something gets logged if you set read_affinity with a sort_method of timing?

There was a spurious 'i' added to a href in a comment in proxy.server

Unsure on the handling of sort_method and read_affinity config options in the policy get_config case - could use clarification - if it was just to avoid some test churn it'd almost defiantly be better to update the tests."}, {'account_id': 14966, 'date': '2015-04-22 18:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(8 comments)

I agree that it won't be much harder to make it as attribute after version middleware and copy extraction in another patch.

There is one test I'm trying to think how to do it: validate copy feature using different sorting strategies for origin and destiny's containers.

I will update the current tests as you suggested and also think about more tests related to sort_nodes method.

I'll try to avoid duplicated code with the check_config.

No issues with get_config, only a wish that I commented in there. I'll update.

Thanks for the review"}, {'account_id': 14966, 'date': '2015-04-22 22:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14966, 'date': '2015-04-22 22:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14966, 'date': '2015-04-22 23:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-23 01:58:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add storage policy support for sorting method

It adds the option for a storage policy to override the "sorting"
strategy defined at proxy-server.conf according to its storage
policy section at swift.conf.

Implements: blueprint sorting-method-storage-policy

Change-Id: Ieec92727d2ca214f79f2e7bd8eb027f7be200123

subject: Add doc/requirements

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 16:16:18.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I77bbf9eac7bfe707aeed40980cfddfb5f0be2f91
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I77bbf9eac7bfe707aeed40980cfddfb5f0be2f91

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-05 10:33:20.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug however it doesn't
produce any doc or releasenotes, but uniformization can't hurt and help
us in the future.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug however it doesn't
produce any doc or releasenotes, but uniformization can't hurt and help
us in the future.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Idec7e542c286e3d9746e58286ffd4ef6561db47b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 15:31:40.000000000', 'message': 'Use systemd sockets for libvirt

Since libvirt 5.7 we should not use traditional mode. Instead systemd
mode should be choosen. Sockets are provided by libvirt package.
We just need to conditionally enable or disable them.

As addition we changed nova_libvirtd_listen_tls to 0 by default
because listen_tls requires certificate to be provided which is not
the case in the current role state. So we also fix behaviour of the role
when nova_libvirtd_listen_tls is 1, supposing that deployer has manually
distributed certificates across compute hosts.

Change-Id: Id73cb67de26c305908d0245551fa57a7e6448784
Closes-Bug: #1903846

commit_message:
Use systemd sockets for libvirt

Since libvirt 5.7 we should not use traditional mode. Instead systemd
mode should be choosen. Sockets are provided by libvirt package.
We just need to conditionally enable or disable them.

As addition we changed nova_libvirtd_listen_tls to 0 by default
because listen_tls requires certificate to be provided which is not
the case in the current role state. So we also fix behaviour of the role
when nova_libvirtd_listen_tls is 1, supposing that deployer has manually
distributed certificates across compute hosts.

Change-Id: Id73cb67de26c305908d0245551fa57a7e6448784
Closes-Bug: #1903846

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2 and fix requirements

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

python-memcached versions needed to be fixed to make check-requirements
job passed.

Contradicting hacking (and thus flake8) lower constraint needed to be
fixed to match and make lower-constraints job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615o

Change-Id: I35780af8c858d44c3c5cb780af72d28e85693352

to unpack it back on the next step. Just pass the file directly.

commit_message:
Simplify injecting network data into an ISO image

Currently we're building a VFAT image with the network data just
to unpack it back on the next step. Just pass the file directly.
This fixes a permission denied problem on Bifrost on Fedora
(at least).

As a nice side effect, the change reduces the amount of IO done
for virtual media quite substantially.

Also re-enable ironic-tempest-partition-uefi-redfish-vmedia

Change-Id: I5499fa42c1d82a1a29099fbbba6f45d440448b72
(cherry picked from commit d48479b52da7ede21f26299db4bd0370bb71ec21)

commit_message:
Sort imports with isort

This is a one-time tool use - we don't need to do this
ongoing, hacking should keep us in line. The command run
was:

  isort --multi-line=3 --trailing-comma --force-grid-wrap=0 --use-parentheses --line-width=88 -rc openstack

after isort[requirements] was installed.

Change-Id: Ic2ee2f8425f0b0f6350395378eb56a6c57047ac9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 19:28:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add ControlePlaneStaticRoutes back in

In the conversion from the old network configurations to the new ones,
we lost the ability to control the static routes for the Control Plane.
This change adds ControlPlaneStaticRoutes back in to the system which
will be appended to any network generated routes.  Our previous use case
was a standalone deployment on a single nic needed the default gateway
added into the network configuration. Since the network configuration
for the standalone uses the control plane network by default, we need to
allow people to continue to use ControlePlaneStaticRoutes.

Change-Id: Ia18c8b88a51314a4a37fa763547d26c13c5598c0
'}]
commit_message:
Add ControlePlaneStaticRoutes back in

In the conversion from the old network configurations to the new ones,
we lost the ability to control the static routes for the Control Plane.
This change adds ControlPlaneStaticRoutes back in to the system which
will be appended to any network generated routes.  Our previous use case
was a standalone deployment on a single nic needed the default gateway
added into the network configuration. Since the network configuration
for the standalone uses the control plane network by default, we need to
allow people to continue to use ControlePlaneStaticRoutes.

Change-Id: Ia18c8b88a51314a4a37fa763547d26c13c5598c0

messages:

We can probably abandon this change since https://review.opendev.org/769169 is supposed to fix this scenario as well'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-01-07 14:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

"abandoned for https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/769169"'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 12:43:53.000000000', 'message': '[QUEENS-ONLY] - Add ignore_errors to the docker stop task

As per [1] when the docker package is updated a "docker stop"
task should be run against ceph-mon containers to make them
aligned with their systemd units.
However, if systemctl is-active ceph-mon@* task fails (returning
a value != 0), the next one should be skipped.
Since evaluating the output of the shell command cannot give
more details about the reason of the failure, adding an ignore
errors should be safe to prevent whole playbook to fail during
the attempt of recovering the ceph-mon systemd unit.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/753636/

Change-Id: I1d74af75a2c99996d392dc314d67b33dc1ab5d57
'}]
commit_message:
[QUEENS-ONLY] - Add ignore_errors to the docker stop task

As per [1] when the docker package is updated a "docker stop"
task should be run against ceph-mon containers to make them
aligned with their systemd units.
However, if systemctl is-active ceph-mon@* task fails (returning
a value != 0), the next one should be skipped.
Since evaluating the output of the shell command cannot give
more details about the reason of the failure, adding an ignore
errors should be safe to prevent whole playbook to fail during
the attempt of recovering the ceph-mon systemd unit.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/753636/

Change-Id: I1d74af75a2c99996d392dc314d67b33dc1ab5d57

Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this topic was
discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to to test lower-constraints
[1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

commit_message:
Added function for figure out link for the resource.

Because Kubernetes will stop propagating metadata.selLink field in
release 1.20 and it will be removed in release 1.21, we need to adapt
and calculate selfLink equivalent by ourselves.

In this patch new function is introduced, which will return the path for
provided resource.

Also, we need to deal with list of resources, since for some reason CRs
do have information regarding apiVersion and the kind, while as for core
resources the apiVersion is only on top of the list object, kind is
something like *List, and object within 'items' are without either
apiVersion nor kind.

Implements: blueprint selflink
Change-Id: I721a46ea0379382f7eb2e13c59bd193314f37e7f

Add schema files to compare against after squashing

These are generated using the 'generate-schemas' tool included in this
change and then renamed to "before" rather than after.

commit_message:
Enable pylint

This is a follow-up from [1] which underlined that the code lacks even basic coverage as it allow
us to introduce a costly regression which could have being detected by pylint no-member test.

- enables pylint with most checks temporary disabled, so we have time
  to address them gradually
- fixes few minor issues reported by the tool
- adds skips for some known "no-member" errors but avoids adding it to the exclude list, as this
  in order to prevent further regressions.
- once landed we can easily address the temporary disabled errors, one by one. In fact this is could
  prove as a very good learning experience for newer team members. They can start by removing on
  random exclusion and fixing it. As a hint: leave the missing docstrings for the end, some problems
  are more important to fix first.

1: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/762892/6/tripleo_common/image/builder/buildah.py

Change-Id: I10ab0cbfbaab77b9208e9a5d74d59eb041cb16ee

commit_message:
Install swift keystone extras requirements

Since the introduction of I8f24b839bf42e2fb9803dc7df3a30ae20cf264
s-proxy is no longer able to launch as keystonemiddleware (listed under
test-requirements.txt) has not been installed.

keystonemiddleware is listed as extras requirements in swift
- https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/e0d46d77fa740768f1dd5b989a63be85ff1fec20/setup.cfg#L79

Let's install swift keystone extra requirements also.

Closes-Bug: #1909018
Change-Id: I02c692e95d70017eea03d82d75ae6c5e87bde8b1
(cherry picked from commit 04b0b61557f7dad6c32b566255c21a36e4b0aefa)
(cherry picked from commit 90651cb1a914999afd1dd1e4929c04e62fefb4c8)
(cherry picked from commit 10fdf258bacf4702917f1bbdffef933e7a89907a)
